The room featured a small but cozy balcony that looked over PCH and toward the ocean. The downside of this is that the traffic noise from PCH was disturbing at night. Additionally, the stairs leading up to the room needed repairs and felt as if they could collapse at any moment. As for the staff, they lacked any appearance of friendliness. However, the stay was still quite nice.
Manager Response: Hi ike772021,   Thank you for your valued and motivating feedback and for leaving a 5 Star Review. Our team works hard to the best of our ability to ensure we satisfy your everyday needs and we are pleased to know we succeed in doing so. We will share your kind words with the staff. Please come again to see us soon!

Summary: Clean room, free parking, walking distance to the beach, rude front desk employee, no daily housekeeping, no microwave, no iron/ironing board, restaurants are 30 minutes by foot, convenience store next door, coffee/coffee maker in the room.
Manager Response: Dear rallen335857,   I'm sorry to hear that your most recent stay with us did not meet your expectations of quality service, accommodations, and hospitality.   In regards to the front desk staff, I will address your concerns and make sure this behavior doesn't happen. At all times we will provide an efficient, friendly and helpful service to all our customers.   We have implemented many new guidelines and procedures for cleaning in our hotel rooms.  We focus on "high touch" areas that could harbor germs, and have implemented additional cleanings of those areas, in addition to other steps we are taking around the hotel, to protect our guests and staff members.  Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention so that we can make sure no future guest experiences the same inconvenience.

Summary: This hotel has helpful and friendly staff, and is a comfortable and clean place to stay while enjoying the beautiful beaches and great town of Laguna Beach. There is ample underground parking, for no extra charge. The beds were comfortable, and the rooms/bathrooms were spacious.  We had a good experience, and  would be very happy to return.
Manager Response: Hi lisacM3154EQ,   Thank you so much for your compliments on our staff and we were able to meet your expectations of cleanliness and service in our hotel.  Our ultimate ambition is to provide a comfortable experience, and we are thrilled to learn that we have succeeded. I am glad that we were able to meet your expectations of service and accommodations and we're all looking forward to your next visit!

Summary: Killer location and in excellent condition for its age. Will go back. Ask for room nearer the rear so no PCH road noise. Has a pool but closed probably because of covid. Same with cleaning the rooms but we were always able to get what we needed from the staff. With a great location you have free parking and can walk downtown anywhere.
Manager Response: Hi GMWood2015,   We appreciate your candid feedback. We are glad to know you found the location of our hotel convenient and enjoyed our hotel's amenities provided. We have shared your feedback with our staff to ensure we continuously work on bettering our services. We will do our best to make sure your next stay with us is completely satisfactory.   During this uncertain time, we strive to ensure that we uphold our high standards for the safety of our guests and we want to assure you that we will use your comments to address this issue with our team.  We look forward to hosting you again in the future!

Summary: Yes it is near the beach - after a walk a few blocks down and a very, very steep hill. Yes there is free parking but it is underground so you must heft luggage up a ramp to get to the elevator. Lobby closes at 8pm. No free breakfast. No sitting area in room. No blackout curtains. Hot water for showers was Not hot - which was extra disappointing as the bathtub was HUGE. A bit of noise due to perhaps a family that had rooms on either side of ours - kids running back and forth. It is a good location to access other locations. They did provide extra coffee pods when asked/keurig in room was nice (had hot chocolate too!). No microwave. The Cliff restaurant just down the street very nice. Rough sheets.
Manager Response: Dear e w,   Our Hotel is working hard to follow the CDC guidelines, and all of our local county and state recommendations when it comes to Covid-19.  We are all doing the best that we can for our valued guests. During this uncertain time, we strive to ensure that we uphold our high standards for the safety of our guests and we want to assure you that we will use your comments to address this issue with our team.  As for the breakfast service, it has been on hold due to the current situation. We hope to be back to normal someday soon, and we thank you for your understanding.    We have shared your concerns with the appropriate individuals, and we have taken action to ensure a better experience for future guests. We appreciate your patience and hope to see you again soon.

Summary: The staff was friendly and accommodating bit checking in and out of the property.  The room was surprisingly big and extremely clean!  It is not beachfront but extremely close to a nice beach cove (2-5 minute walk at most).   Affordable hotel that checks all the boxes.
Manager Response: Hi Maps67305156046,   We are exceptionally thankful that you have honored our staff members with praiseworthy words. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and are happy to hear you had a great experience with us. We will always ensure that we keep delighting you with our facilities and services.   Again, thank you and we look forward to serving you again on your next visit.

Summary: The hotel is close to the beach and downtown Laguna so very convenient. Nice big fridge in the room and lots of storage space. I missed the housekeeping service and breakfast because of covid but otherwise great!
Manager Response: Hi dannahx,   Thank you so much for your kind words. I’m so pleased that you found us a clean and pleasant place to stay and that our amenities and our location were to your liking.   An thank you for bearing with us while we have restrictions regarding our breakfast service.  We hope to be back to normal someday soon, and we thank you for your understanding.    We take real pride in this hotel and in serving guests like you, and I’m extremely happy that you had such a pleasant stay. We look forward to having you with us again soon.

Summary: A unique hotel on the edge of the PCH . I personally enjoyed the hotel very much , although I do admit , that it is noisy . Though , that aside , everything else makes up for it . Convenient underneath parking , with easy access ( however getting out on the main road - another story)  The room was very urban modern - clean minimalist, spacious , with kool touch lighting . The bathroom was huge . The basic amenities were perfect ( fridge , coffee maker) The bed was very comfortable with decent pillows .TV large & flat screen.  I felt a good deal of effort was put into cleanliness. The room also had alcohol wipes for guest. Location idea . Highly recommend
Manager Response: Hi JMChep,   We appreciate your candid feedback. We are glad to know you found the location of our hotel convenient and enjoyed our hotel's amenities provided. We have shared your feedback with our staff to ensure we continuously work on bettering our services.   We will also be working on your observation. We will do our best to make sure your next stay with us is completely satisfactory. We look forward to hosting you again in the future!

Summary: I would not recommend this hotel - it was loud with traffic throughout the night and the bathroom is extremely outdated - no microwave in the room and the refrigerator was not working We were so excited to stay in Laguna Beach but left after one night because of the noise
Manager Response: none

Summary: Wasn't expecting much but definitely fell below expectations. Room was small, and dirty. No cleaning service, hair dryer was ripped off wall and stolen, no toiletries or tissues. Poor customer service.  Would get a better night's sleep sleeping in my car.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Modern Spacious Room, Amazing Beach, Hiking Trail Behind the Hotel
Summary: The Art Hotel isn't very appealing on the outside, but the room itself was very inviting, spacious, modern, no carpet, great bathroom, and balcony in  room 202 was small but offered a partial ocean view. The hotel was not offering breakfast due to Covid, but the mini mart right next to the hotel was a plus to grab coffee, drinks, snacks.   The beach across the street is stunning, and we enjoyed having a hiking trail that started just behind the hotel! During the day we'd walk to central Laguna Beach for lunch (0.8 miles away), at night we drove.  You do hear noise from the PCH, but that will happen in any hotel you stay in the area. I would stay here again.  Tip for meals "3" offered a delicious menu for breakfast and lunch(small menu but all items seemed inviting to me), most
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this nice little hotel for just 1 night. We loved it. Our room a had a little view of the ocean, which was beautiful. The highway noise is a bit annoying if you're trying to sleep in( not their fault)..the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom really clean. I don't understand all the complaining by some of these reviewers. This is a very nice hotel,and its in a very good location. The check in was easy, and the front desk woman was very friendly and accommodating.  The only cons were no microwave, and there is a gap under the door and my hubby cut his toe on it. (Not really the hotels fault)
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The old rooms are luosy, but the remodeled rooms with the balcony are great!
Summary: We got one of the old rooms which felt old and dirty but there were no roaches or anything to complain about other than them being old looking. Had I known I would have chosen the newer remodeled rooms that they post pictures of with the balcony! So my only suggestion is maybe beware if you get one of the older rooms it will be rather disappointing, unless they remodel the old ones like the new remodeled rooms.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Benny at the desk was a very kind man. On Memorial Day weekend he did his best to accommodate our group, even though changes due to COVID-19 made it difficult. Also Isis at the desk was a great help and very pleasant. Enjoy your stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here on my first visit to Laguna beach and loved the small, quaint feel of the hotel. the art and decor throughout the hotel gives it such a nice vibe and boutique feel to it. The location is perfect, walking distance to the beach and restaurants. It is located right off the main road but I did not hear any traffic sounds in my room. Would definitely stay here on my next visit.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice for short stay to visit with family
Summary: Enjoyed my stay, my brother lives within 50ft of the hotel making it super convenient.  The rooms are modernized and well decorated and very well laid out.   The hotel itself is low key and quiet.   Request one of the back rooms if you are a light sleeper.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I am an 11 year customer of the Art Hotel in Laguna Beach. As I walked in my room this evening at about 1130 ready to go to sleep tired, I found a cockroach in the middle of the white bedspread on the bed. And then another cockroach in the bathroom. I immediately called the front desk and nicely asked for another room. They did accommodate me and put me in another room. I unloaded my gear stocked the fridge and went into the bathroom, I found another cockroach in this room. Well that was enough for me to want to leave this hotel. I called the front desk told him I had found another cockroach and asked that they refund me my money and that they find another hotel for me to stay at and that they pay for that new hotel. They did not accommodate me. Which is extremely bad business
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very nice large updated rooms.  Beautiful walk in shower.  Should not claim breakfast is included .  Very simple fare . In fact, check in clerk told us we would get a snack in the morning .  Location of hotel is fine
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are working with agencies to give us a n option to put snacks instead of breakfast. Unfortunately they do not have this option for us.

Summary Heading: Great Motel in sight of Laguna Beach
Summary: Art Hotel sits across the street from the beach with a slight ocean view over the houses across the street, if you are on the second floor. Rooms are good size and very clean. A very friendly representative called us an hour before check in to let us know the room was ready for us and provided us with everything we needed to know to get around the area. She let us know about the complementary "morning snack" which was very appropriately stated with granola bars, pastries, apples, and Keurig coffee for breakfast, which is a nice bonus. Only cons were very loud road noise, which is to be expected on side of highway, and really slow wifi. The price was great being across from beach, would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you Melinda for the great detailed review. We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us here and we would love for you to come back.

Summary Heading: Quaint stay walking distance from beach.
Summary: We had a lovely two nights in this boutique style hotel. There are some upgrades that have been done to the rooms but the exterior needs refurbishing. We had trouble with the bathroom door (too heavy to open and close easily) and with the condition of the stairs - very worn. The breakfast was very tiny and limited in the amount offered. Although the ad I read said it has an ocean view, I couldn't see it from the room - but it was a short walk to a very nice beach area and a longer but nice walk to the Main Beach.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. Please let us know where you saw this ad where it states "ocean view", We are removing this wording and we have done it with all of our major sites unless they are a third party we do not knbow of. We do not advertise ocean view at all and I do apologize that there was an ad you saw with this sicription. Nevertheless I am very happy that you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: I was notified the day of the reservation that my reservation was never canceled and I had no choice but to pay for it. The lady at the front desk who is the most senior employee present claimed the manager is in/out and rarely around but it seems that she is the manager but is evading customers by saying there is nothing she can do. This place does bad business, do not support it. It was booked through Wyndham, and the lady at the front desk said to resolve the matter with them, but Wyndham said they would file a customer care complaint and to try to resolve with the hotel. I went to the hotel in person, and again, got the runaround. These are shady people that will just take your money.
Manager Response: Thank you for your insight. The cancellation policy was very clear to you when you booked the reservation. As explained to you over the phone and in person that due tp you not cancelling the reservation (which you admit to) you were charged. It is like a contract when you booked room with a valid credit card we guarantee you a room. The lady at the front desk as well as the Wydham customer care employee customer care employee explained this to you that due to your error you would be charged. You have to take some responsibility with your error/ your judgement. We are e not responsible for you overlooking any details.

Summary: We booked this hotel through Hotels.com on TripAdvisor. We chose it for its close proximity to family for 3 nights over Thanksgiving. We were notified by a nice phone call that our room was ready early. We were given a king bed as requested.  The room was right on Coast Highway and the engines of the cars, trucks, and motorcycles was non stop! As a result we were unable to sleep. There were no black out curtains and the floodlights of the property filtered into our room. It was an awful night! At 7:30 we went to management to see if we could change rooms for the remaining 2 nights. We were told that was not possible because they were booked when in fact there were only a handful of cars in the parking lot and available rooms showing on TripAdvisor.  They did finally say we could
Manager Response: Thank you for insight. As explained to you the type of rooms that you booked are only on the first floor and you booked a king bed pet friendly. which are located there to make it convenient for our guests o take their pets in and out. During the winter season majority of our property is closed for renovations and we were unable to accommodate you. The rooms that were available were available for that 1 day you were looking at the rates but not all three days of your stay. We tried to explain that to you and you were just not getting it. I apologize that we were unable to accommodate you but we do try our best but for some reason you understood Isis who explained the same things to you. It makes me wonder why when we were saying the same exact thing.

Summary Heading: Art Hotel in Laguna Beach Ca is a quaint clean boutique hotel with modern rooms.
Summary: Best thing going for this small hotel is it’s location and proximity to the beach. It was very clean and rooms were modern. The continental breakfast could use improvement and coffee is only available for free from 8-10 along with the limited breakfast. However, the short walk across the road to Crescent Bay city park and the ocean views there, make up for any of the hotels shortcomings!! For the price it can’t be beat!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.

Summary: I took a spontaneous trip to Laguna and booked at the Art Hotel. I’ve never been or heard of it and I must say it was a GREAT choice! The rooms are amazingly modern, clean, and overall beautiful. Nasir was very accommodating as I had a very late check in. He was pleasant , helpful and informative.  I will definitely be back !
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We don't mind assisting and accommodating our  guests. We try to asisist you in  anyway we can so you can enjoy your stay. Thank you and we do hope to see you soon.

Summary: Awesome new room that is freshly renovated. The room is very clean and very up to date. The beds are very comfortable. The staff is very informational and friendly. They are setting the bar for hotel hospitality.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are glad you enjoyed your stay here. Please keep in mind not all rooms are updated. We are working on renovating more rooms in the near future.

Summary: For the amount we had to pay fo rthe room I thought the room would be better. We had a  smell of cat urine everytime we entered our room but it went away once we opened the sliding door. We didn't call the front desk becuse I felt that they probably couldn't fix the issue.  The breafeast was lame. You pay for better quality food and get store bought stuff. Free Coffe for reafast aonly and then pay $1.00 a cup from a Keurig machone that looks old.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.

Summary: This was our fourth stay at this hotel.  We were upgraded to room 201 which was very clean and new looking. The room is on the coast highway which was the opposite of what I had booked.  We stay out late and sleep in so we wanted a room in the back.  There were a few things that should be looked at :::  The toilet seat cover is not secure and slid off the fixture when closing.  The bath's barn door is not properly mounted so it rubs the door trim and catches the floor.  After entering the bath my fiance had closed the door tightly then couldn't open it to get out without my help.  The key cards are not marked, just plain white on both sides.  There is no "make up room" card.....just a "do not disturb" card.   The continental breakfast consisted of only store bought nut bars and
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback

Summary: I had a good expereience here.  The rooms were recently upgraded and were very nice.  We had ocean view from our room, although I don't think all rooms have that.  There is a great little beach just down the street in easy walking distance.  The housekeeping made sure we never ran out of anything.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I am glad you were able to enjoy your stay. You are right not all rooms have an ocean view since we are not an ocean front property. I am also happy that you were able to enjoy one of my favorite beaches which is close to our location.

Summary: Very clean, updated rooms with nice service.walking distance to beach and local stores and restaurants. Also have pool, balconies,  and a sunpatio to hang out on.Will definitely come back. Can't wait to bring my girls here they will love Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: Thank you Nicole, It was a pleasure meeting you and we are glad you enjoyed your stay here with us. We can't wait to see you and your girls here.

Summary: I recently stayed at the hotel in one of the newly upgraded rooms which was clean, modern and tastefully done. It was nice to see multiple USB power connections bedside and entertainment area. I would definitely recommend the property if planning to visit Laguna Beach
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I am glad the little details have been appreciated . It was a pleasure having you here and we hope to see you again.

Summary: Beautiful location.  You can walk down to crescent bay and enjoy the ocean.  Would definitely come back.  The rooms are beautifully updated as well!  The staff is very friendly and helpful and will answer any questions you have.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I am glad our staff was able to take care of you and were able to answer your questions. We hope to see you soon please keep in mind at this moment not all rooms are remodeled so when reserving a room you check with the front desk first so we can ensure you get the remodeled room. We do hope to begin soon. .

Summary: We were a bit worried about our booking after reading some of the below reviews and seeing some room photos of before the refurb.  The hotel is no frills but exceeded my expectations. Friendly and helpful check in. Refurbished room and really nice and modern showeroom. Comfortable beds, new furniture.  Pillows and linen were fine. Very clean throughout.  Breakfast snacks and coffee were great considering included in the price!  We stayed labour day weekend as a last minute booking but would stay again as the location was great. 5 mins walk to cliff beach, crescent bay point and 5 mins by uber into the center of Laguna. Parking is also included!
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are working on modernizing our rooms and planning to update more rooms in the near future. I am glad you were able to enjoy your stay and see the effort we are all putting into making guest experience better

Summary: The hotel is close to the trolley stop, making it convenient to get to downtown.  The lady at the desk was very friendly and helpful.  We enjoyed sitting at a quiet table outside our room while it was being cleaned late one afternoon.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I am glad you enjoyed your stay and we hope to see you again next year.

Summary: Beds tooo high, all lights motion detector controlled and came on at night when moving in bed,  Bathroom light went off automatically...too soon.  a fold out couch that was not comfortable to sit on and only 1 other chair, a hard desk chair.  Morning snack was extremely limited
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We will look into your concern and try to fix this issue as soon as we can.

Summary Heading: BYOP Bring Your Own Pillows and Air Freshener
Summary: 3of8 pillows  were replaced with pillows that smelled. Pillows should have been thrown out. Sleeper sofa was old covered with a blanket? I purchased pillows at Walmart along with Febreze air freshener and a glade plug in air freshener
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. When you get a chance please give us a call to let us know which room you had a concern with. Majority of our rooms no longer have a carpet. We still have carpet in some but hope to have it removed soon.

Summary: For about $250, for one night, we were expecting a comfortable bed, not a hard mattress with slabs of concretes for pillows and itchy sheets. The outdoor area light which stayed on all night, along with road noise (even though we were promised a quiet room) made sleeping challenging. Ironically, the "art" hotel had no decor in the room. On the positive side, given that we had to change our dates last minute due to a medical situation, they were nice enough to waive the 100% fee.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. The beds are new they have been changed prior to summer of 2019. I apologize you did not find them comfortable. The sheets are outsourced and laundered from an outside company to ensure the cleanliness of the sheets. We do not do the laundry here. I assure you we are in the process oif moving forward with updating our property and adding art work to promote the local artist.

Summary Heading: Don't let the Wyndham name fool you.
Summary: Dirty room that I had to go buy cleaner to feel comfortable in. Beds are hard as a rock, and sofa bed is so outdated and torn. They have a blanket over it, and I was told that's so you'll have it when you need it to sleep. Some rooms have been half way remodeled,  and there really isn't any ocean view from any of the rooms.
Manager Response: I am sorry you did not enjoy your stay with us,. We do not advertise "ocean view" since we are not an ocean front property. .

Summary Heading: Website Photos are Award Worthy, Property is not!!!
Summary: The photos of this property on the website are not at all what this place looks like in person. It was clean and the front desk management was good. However, for the price--and with the Wyndham name attached, we were expecting so much more. Our room was billed as a 2 queen deluxe with a pull out sofa. The photos show it as a suite with the pull out sofa in separate room. That was not the case. The furniture was so cramped in the room, the pull out was nearly impossible to open and walk in the room. Also--the room rate was listed as 268, but we were charged an additional $20 for each person beyond 2 people.  The room had a maximum of 5 people capacity--not sure why we were charged extra for any bodies beyond 2??? The decor was terrible--as if it hadn't been updated in 20 years.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I apologize but we do not advertise suites. We no longer even advertise sofa beds. You will be happy o know as soon as summer is over as part of our renovation we will be removing the uincomfortable sofa beds.

Summary Heading: Bad reviews since December - Pay Attention: Something Wrong With This Place
Summary: Please take notice of all the 1-star ratings in relation to the last 9 months: They all are bunched together. There is something wrong with this place. We had the worst experience, ever, in our 20 years of traveling to this area. We are saavy, and know our hotels. NEVER stay at this place, ever, unless you have fully checked out it. Stay at your own risk.
Manager Response: Thank you.

Summary: Our room had not been vacuumed when we first checked in. There was a dead roach & a hair tie on floor. There was mold in the shower and we saw a roach crawling up the wall. When I brought it up to the staff, she didn't even apologized. She just said she would look into it. It was a great location & a great price, but that was it.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We do apologize for the mishap and I assure we do have a company looking into this matter. We have also changed our housekeeping agency to ensure we are providing cleaner rooms to our guests. We are making many gradual changes and updating/ renovating the rooms is next on our list. I many of our rooms we have eliminated the carpet.

Summary Heading: Just stay away from this place
Summary: This hotel generally gets good reviews, but when someone does post something negative expect the manager to write a snarky or passive aggressive response. That same behavior is noted at the property if you approach staff with a complaint, as well. They do not value their guests.
Manager Response: Thank You

Summary: This was perhaps the most disappointing hotel room I have ever stayed in. My expectations were set based on the WYNDHAM name being attached to the property and this hotel does not come even close. The parking was fine, the pool was fine and check in was quick and efficient. We had booked for a “pet friendly” room and that too was taken care of. Off to the room and the adventure begins. There is an elevator on the property. We used our room key to attempt to access it in the garage but it did not come. We walked up the ramp to the lobby and asked about the elevator thinking perhaps our key wasn’t working properly. No, the elevator does not work to the garage. For some reason management or ownership have chosen to make everyone walk to the lobby area to then be able to use the
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are very sorry we did not meet your standard and will work hard to make the necessary improvements. Please note we are in the process of remodeling our rooms and hope to begin when the busy season is over.

Summary: Stayed at the art hotel, check in with isis was great went over a lot of the near by activities happening. There is a free trolly you can take right across the street, the only problem I had was in my shower was an open soap with hair on it and the shampoo bottle open.  We got back around 11pm when we noticed it so that sucked but the staff was apologetic and came to clean it.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Quaint Hotel on the quiet side of Laguana Beach
Summary: Great little Wyndham property on the quiet side of Laguana Beach. Great beach near by and close to trolley to get to some great shopping and dining. If you want a laid back Laguana experience, then the Art Hotel is the place for you!!
Manager Response: Thank you Charles, for the outstanding review. We are glad you enjoyed your stay and we hope you choose us again.

Summary: This pretty hotel is in a great location right on the PCH (highway 1), fairly close to the beach, just across and down a side street.  It is painted with a beautiful mural.  They have a small parking garage under the first level of rooms, it's free to park, and relatively easy to navigate.  The first floor is up a small flight of stairs, but there is an elevator.  The bathroom in our room was huge, and very clean.  I love that they had dispensers fixed to the wall with shampoo, conditioner and body wash.  They also have hand soap and lotion dispensers on the wall near the sink.  There's a free continental breakfast in the morning starting at 8am only until 10am, we missed it.  I love the seating in the pool area.  The pool is not heated and there's no jacuzzi/hot tub, the girls
Manager Response: Thank you and we are glad you and your family were able to enjoy your vacation. It was a pleasure meeting you all. I am glad you noticed the little details we have in our room. We hope to see you again on your next visit into Laguna Beach.

Summary Heading: Don't go til Wyndham confirms renovation is complete
Summary: After 18 years of lovely stays at this hotel, I had an awful experience during my early June stay. I checked in after dark and could not see the property. Desk manager said there was some "light renovation" and painting going on, and requested full payment for my four-night stay.   The next morning I was awakened by construction noise of saws and jackhammers - the rooms beginning 6 feet away were under (loud) demolition and the facade of the building looked wrecked. Wet paint everywhere. There were at least 8 construction workers on site at this small property with materials stacked in guest hallways. Pool inaccessible. No caution signs anywhere, a risk for visitors with kids. Front desk manager offered me 20/off per night or offered that I could move to another hotel. I stayed
Manager Response: Thank you for you input The work has been complete since the very next day of your stay. And this was no where near you room it was in a whole different hallway where we were not renting any rooms. We have tried to work with you to ensure your stay is pleasant. There was no disturbance to you remainder of your your stay. As you stated the property needs work it has always needed work hence us doing the remodel. We are not demolishing anything. Once again we truly do apologize you had an awful experience. Pool was never closed. Our bedding is new and modern without the old tattered, smelly bedspreads that were previously there.as well as our beds which many guests love and have asked us where we got them from. They no longer are cushion less and floppy as they were (they were not changed for the 18 years you stayed here). Housekeeping is given every day to our guests unless you have a Do Not Disturb sign on your door. which our records indicate you did we also check at least 3 times a day until it is time for housekeeping to leave for the day.

Summary: Without being told that we'd be staying in a room with a newly painted door and wet carpet, we were eager to get settled after shopping all morning in Crystal Cove Plaza. It took a man's strength to open the door to our room. We realized that, in the event of a fire, we would not be able to get out of our room. We told the woman at the front desk, but she was too busy (on the phone) to listen or respond appropriately. "Isis" was clearly annoyed to be alerted to the door situation or to the problem of having six or more workers sitting outside our room at a table, resting and chatting after a day's work.  We enjoyed our proximity to Crescent Bay, however, and went out for the rest of the evening. We got a good night's sleep on comfortable, clean beds. Upon trying to open the door
Manager Response: Thank you for your input and I do truly apologize that you were unable to enjoy your time here. Please note we are in the process of updating our rooms and property with as little disturbance to our guests as much as possible. Many guest are appreciating the many wonderful changes we are making.

Summary: Great location. Newly renovated rooms are sleek and contemporary. This property is going to be hot when all remodeling is complete. Convenience store next door and free shuttle pick up across the street make this the perfect spot.
Manager Response: Thank you Sean, It makes me very happy that you loved the new room. This type of feedback is highly appreciated. I hope we get to see you again next year and years to come.

Summary: The rooms carpet or something smelled of urine and something else disgusting. The room was dusty. Ran out of Kleenex and to 2nd day. The front desk staff was very unprofessional, in a hurry and not friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are in the process of upgrading our rooms and removing the carpet is on the top of our list. Please take the time to call us directly so we know which room was smelling to you so we can fix it.

Summary: I have now stayed at this property three times, and have enjoyed it every single time.  It is furnished basically, and is always clean and tidy.  I live out of state, and I have appointments every couple of months in LA, so this location is perfect for us.  The only downside to this location is that it is located directly off the PCH, and so the rooms at the front of the hotel experience the noise of traffic pretty heavily.  The rooms at the back of the hotel can still hear the traffic, but not nearly as badly.  During our most recent stay, my boyfriend and I took a walk on the nearby beaches and he proposed, so our time in this little town and at this property will now always be especially special to us.  We'll definitely continue coming here as long as the check-in process
Manager Response: First of all let me start off by congratulating you and your fiance. I am happy that we will be part of your memory. It was a pleasure meeting you both and you were a joy to have as our guest. We are in the process of remodeling our rooms and I am sure you are going to love them. We hope to have everything completed by end of this year. I do have a recommendation for you as a wedding venue which is the look out point near us. The view is gorgeous and there have been many people who have had their weddings in this area. Please let us know if there is anything we can help you with.

Summary: Under reconstruction its very old and beat up needs to speed up revamp but at almost $200/ night on weekends yikes. This is suppossed to be a Wydham property if it is I probably will never stay at a so called Wydham resort. We went on a rainy weekend and rain blew into our room because there is no cover. Room was ok but was musty and damp tv was 32" i didnt know they made them that small any more.The bath tub had jets whoooh. Staff friendly 5 stars for sure and deserve alot of credit perserving the credibility  They provided good coffee and a small selection semi continental breakfast that was kind of cool Maybe by summertime the place will come together i hope so.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. As you stated we are under a remodel so we hope to have the remodel completed by end of the year. We hope you give us another chance next year.

Summary: The room was clean, quiet, and comfortable.  The new king bed and sheets were very nice and comfortable.  Nice mild soaps for shower!!!  We liked the interesting art work through out the hotel.  They have a nice pool area.  There were three locks for the door to ensure our safety and an easy to access door opener card.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words. I am glad you enjoyed your stay with us and noticed the details that many miss. PAYA is a great brand  which many of our guests  have loved and inquired about. Hope to see you again.

Summary Heading: Motel right on PCH, not bad, good location.
Summary: I found this motel from the Wyndham app. Okay rooms, motel with lower garage, nice new mattress, firm pillows, clean bathroom. Major hassle unloading and loading luggage to garage after lobby is closed.  My early departure was not pleasant as I bumped all our luggage past rooms on a roundabout journey to the lower garage. I am sure I woke everyone on my path due to heavy luggage, sorry about that if I woke you! There is a cool seaside pocket park very close by that is worth the short walk, Crescent Bay I think it is called. The receptionist was awesome and informative on checkin. Be aware of the lobby hours if you plan to book this motel.
Manager Response: Glad you had a great time with us. I am happy you were able to enjoy your stay as well as our local beaches.  As we stated at check in if for any reason you need access to the lobby during certain hours just call us and we will give you the access. There is no problem, someone is always here for your assistance. I hope to see you soon.

Summary: Not impressed. The coffee service in the hotel lobby is scheduled to finish at 10 am. The coffee machine is self service.There are paper cups. Arriving after 10 am I asked the person behind the desk for a coffee.  'No it's over you're too late.' 'But we have 5 rooms and we're staying for 4 nights." 'You can't have any coffee, If I give it to you. I'll have to give to everyone.' 'But there's just you and I here.' 'You can't have any,' and exits stage left.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. Our breakfast hours are 8:00 am to 10:00a.m. Your room was paid by a wonderful woman who was notified as well as all your team members of the breakfast hours at check in. I will pass your concern up to the wonderful woman whom I have befriended.  On the third day of your stay you came in at approximately 11:00 am for coffee. If it is close to 10:00 am we have no problem opening everything up and bringing out all the products that were put away. I am sorry you were the only one who had a bad experience but I definitely know your other band members loved staying with us as well as have stated they would be happy to see us again soon. Please pass my regards to them it was lovely speaking to them every morning over coffee.

Summary Heading: Horrible Hotel avoid at all costs
Summary: This hotel will cancel your reservations on your way to a wedding because they overbooked. I would recommend looking anywhere else.  Management is zero help. Avoid like the plague.  Worst employees I have ever had to deal with in staying in hotels and I stay at over 30 nights a year in hotels.
Manager Response: I am going to have to disagree with you. This review is false. Your reservation was not cancelled due to over booking but due to your behavior. We had to deny you a room. Our front desk had  called you  to notify you that your card had declined when we tried to validate/ authorize your credit card to ensure a guest provides us an authentic credit card. Usually a hotel will not give you a courtesy call or try and get in touch with the guest when this happens and cancels the reservation but we do give our guests a benefit of the doubt and allow them to give us another valid credit card and in your case this is what the front desk did. But instead of appreciating this phone call you verbally abused the front desk and was not cooperative, you started to use profanity and threatened to use the power of the internet to write  a negative review ( you succeeded, but I hope people read both sides to this story). Both the front desk and I were trying to explain to you what this call was for but for some reason you did not want to understand why you were being contacted. Once we finally just had to make a decision to not have you as our guest due to your behavior we had to say please do not come in and we will be cancelling your reservations. We cannot accommodate someone who is going to be screaming at us , using profanity through out their stay. This all happened due to a courtesy call that was benefiting you. It just didn't make sense to us. It still does not. We did notify your booking agency of this and they agreed we were in the right and we followed protocol. I truly hope you have learned your lesson that this type of behavior is not acceptable and any business employee had the right to refuse service. Though I highly doubt it since you still wrote this false review.

Summary: Our party had two rooms. They were side by side ocean front. Balconies are tiny and are right over the street and the ac is inches away so the noise on the balcony is fairly loud and the heat coming off the AC is a bit annoying; that said, it was fun to people watch! The noise from the traffic can be heard from inside, but not bad and the traffic dies down at night so it is not an issue (I sleep with ear buds). Rooms were great for the price, basic, but the best price for the area. Staff was very friendly. Bus stopped right at the corner, but the hotel is well within walking distance of major tourist attractions / Pageant of the Masters for a healthy person. We will defiantly choose Art Hotel again when we come for the Art Festival. Small free breakfast consists of granola bars,
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful feedback. I do agree with you we do have a gem of a place here tucked away at the north end of Laguna Beach yet still close enough to many attractions. Unfortunately like majority of the hotels in Laguna Beach one of our major attraction is Highway 1 (Pacific Coast Highway) it is great to have but cuts right through the town. I iam glad you enjoyed you stay with us and have chosen us for your next vacation when in Laguna Beach. We are working on updating our property amd it would be nice for you to see the changes..

Summary: I booked this based on the reviews and also close proximity to the downtown area as well as the price.  Hotel is no frills, some may even consider it pricey for what you get.  You are paying for the location but it had charm and staff was super nice.   There’s a shuttle directly across the street which is great and I guess the beach isn’t too far away also.  I can’t confirm that because we visited thousand steps beach before we checked in so I don’t know what the specific beach is that’s closest to the hotel.  Offers Free parking and there’s a market next door which is convenient for snacks and water, etc.  I will also say the pop towels they provide are soooo nice - super fluffy and soft.   I would definitely stay here again if visiting the area.
Manager Response: HI Angelina thank you for the wonderful review. Yes Laguna Beach offer free trolley services during the summer months which is very convenient for guests visiting Laguna. There is a wonderful beach which is right down the hill from us which is call the Crescent Bay beach. I highly recommend it specially for day travelers as well as for families and couples. This is a great beach to get away from the hustle and bustle of the main beach. We would love to see you back soon.

Summary: I copied and pasted this from another review because they were my exact sentiments. It's small, and CLEAN. The people who work here are so friendly and helpful. The beds are comfortable.  Breakfast is simple but enough to hold you until lunch. and I am adding this, we requested an early check in and we rec'd a friendly call from Isis while driving and said our room was available for check in at 1:30pm. We called for items before dinner and returned with them located in the room. The location of the hotel has easy access and the trolley service was across the street.Isis was at the desk when we arrived and treated us like Gods.We told her we were eating at Mozambique and she ordered us a free shuttle.For all the negative reviewers, maybe you should try staying at the Ritz or
Manager Response: Thank You for the wonderful review. Isis is a gem to have. We are a great team and our priority is to make our guests feel welcomed. One thing we do offer is when a room is ready we give our guests a personal call/ e-mail letting them know they can check-in early at no charge. This is a plus since not make hotels will offer or do this not even the Montage or Ritz.

Summary: There was confusion as to when our room was ready. First said it was, then wasn't, told us 45 min. I sat in hot sun 35 minutes and never saw a maid's cart by our door. Went to front desk, still confusion--then she sent another employee up and he said it was ready! (found out later they had called us in ILLINOIS at 11 A.M. to tell us room was ready) "Towels" they gave us for beach were thin and ratty. When we turned them in, I took a bottle of water from the fridge and she said "Those are for breakfast!" Guess I looked faint because then she said I could have it. Missed the artwork and notecards for sale in lobby that were there 2 years ago.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. Like all guests as a courtesy we give a call and let them know that their rooms are ready for a free early check in. Unfortunately you provided your home number which is in ILLINOIS instead of your cell phone number when making your reservation.  I am  sure there was a very good  reason for the front desk employee to notify you that the water was available during certain hours. Usually it is when a guest taking more than they should.Many hotels do not even extend that courtesy out to their guests. Luckily we do we just ask that you ask our permission if you could have it out of courtesy. And last and certainly not the least as you noticed he property has been cleaned, new beds, bedding have been changed for guests comfort as well as the amenities are at a higher standard than before. The art work was old dusty and many guests complained that the rooms did not look updated or clean because of it.  We are working with a designing team and the city of Laguna Beach to remodel our property and are looking into implementing new art work from local artists.

Summary: The hotel was very nice and the room was excellent. The location was great, situated by the trolley drop off and pick up. Only negative was when booking it said "breakfast". If your idea of breakfast is miniature fruit and a few finger pastries then that would be fine for you.
Manager Response: Hello Craig, We appreciate your kind words. We would like everyone to know that we are located on the North part of Laguna Beach,. Across from Crescent Bay Beach, less than a mile away from the main beach. Closest hotel to Crystal Cove beach area and a 10 minute drive to NewPort Beach. Amongst many changes we have already made we are working on expanding our breakfast menu. Please come back in the future to see the upcoming changes

Summary: I booked the Art Hotel one late night I believe in February for a 2-day stay July 2018 for our 40th wedding anniversary.  Just shortly after booking, to my surprise my cell phone rang and I looked and it was from a Laguna zip code so I answered it.  It was probably 8:00 pm in Laguna but 11:00 on the East coast.  When I picked up the phone, it was Gail, the owner I believe, congratulating me and telling me the best room would be mine.  Wow I was blown away what customer service.  On the day of our arrival, I received a call from Isis letting me know that our room was ready and we could check in at any time.  That call was greatly appreciated, more customer service.  She even helped us with our luggage.  We arrived about 5:00 pm exhausted after a particularly long day to Cheerful
Manager Response: Hello dapmag3, thank you for your kind words. It makes me very happy that Gail took care of you so well. She is an inspiration. I am happy that you enjoyed your stay with us and like our facility as well as our wonderful staff. We have been in the process of cleaning the place and added new beds to bedding and soon updating the entire property. I hope to see you for your next anniversary.

Summary: Check in clerk extremely friendly and knowledgeable of area. Great location. Near beaches and shopping. Great recommendations for restaurants, catching trellis, and walking distance for nearest beach.
Manager Response: Hello Junid, We appreciate your kind words. We would like everyone to know that we are located on the North part of Laguna Beach,. Across from Crescent Bay Beach, less than a mile away from the main beach. Closest hotel to Crystal Cove beach area.

Summary: My husband and I stayed at this small hotel on an overnight getaway in June 2018. Although it is basic, it was clean, the parking is included, there is no resort fee and the staff was friendly. The pool is small, but they offer large plush pool towels. While it is not exactly in the heart of the Laguna Beach front shopping area, it is conveniently located across the street from the Free Trolly pick up spot that takes you there. This is a plus, because you do not have to deal with the headache of parking in the congested shopping area.
Manager Response: Lovefieldtrips,  Thank you for your review. Yes we are located in North Laguna Beach, walking distance to Crescent Bay Beach, the main beach and galleries, apart  from busy summer street noise similar to other hotels situated on pacific coast hwy, Art Hotel Laguna Beach offers a quieter location.

Summary: We specifically chose this hotel because it was pet friendly and close to the beach.  We booked online and put in for 3 pets as it allowed.  On the day we were to check in, they called to say the room was ready early, we informed them we had planned to wait to drive down closer to the 3 PM check in because of our cats. That’s when things went south, apparently the online allowed us to book a room not designated as pet friendly and that they actually only allow 2 animals to a room, although the online reservations specifically allowed me to book for 3 pets!  We had to quickly make boarding arrangements with our vet, which fortunately they could accommodate our cats otherwise we would have had to cancel our wedding anniversary celebration trip.  Once we got there, we were helped
Manager Response: I apologize that you had to leave your cats at the vets so I looked into your record. The room you had booked was not pet friendly. This is why we were unable to accommodate your pets. If you would have booked a pet friendly room we could have made an exception to allow 3 cats but unfortunately we were unable to overlook everything. I am glad Gail was able to take care of you very well.

Summary: I took a chance on this hotel to take grandson and friend to beach on June 20th. My main concern was it clean. I have to say it was clean and beds were nice. It's not a Hilton but a very nostalgia hotel. Front desk was very nice and accommodating. I would stay there again.
Manager Response: Hi Sandra, It was a pleasure having you and your grandson and his friend  here as well. I am so glad we were part of your adventure with the kids. I have a feeling we will be seeing you again and I hope you do come to see the changes we will be making to our property.

Summary: Excellent location.. check in was going as easy.   Excellent front desk and management...!!! 🤝 they give me call that my room was ready.. so in have early check in at at charge 🛏.  🛀Love sitting at pool area🌈 and love the cleanliness of the room... I would defiantly come back...
Manager Response: Thank You for the great feedback. I will pass it up to my staff.

Summary: I stayed here 2 nights for an event in Laguna. I’m a native Laguna Beach person and I do travel a lot. Waited awhile to check in. Room was horrible. Holes in wall and carpet a mess with holes too. I asked for housekeeping to clean after getting back at 330pm. When they arrived I asked for 5 min so I could finish changing to head to place l. They huffed and puffed and rolled their eyes.  I don’t remember the rest but vowed I’d never go back. Pool area was nice.
Manager Response: I apologize that you had such a negative experience. Our goal is to offer good service to our guests and we have failed. The property is going through a transition and believe me when I say this we are working on updating the  rooms as well as training our team members . We are prepping the rooms as fast as we can with minimal disturbance to our guests. I would love for you to come back and see the changes we have made.

Summary: Cheap hotel, a place to sleep that’s it. Building work going on during stay. Rooms tired and in need of updating. Mattress  uncomfortable.  Staff only positive, helpful and accommodating  However Would not stay again
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We just went through a major transition 2 weeks ago and have been able to start making improvements to the property, One of the improvements are new beds and freshening up the rooms. Our priority is to improve as much as we can before summer kicks in and with as minimal disturbance to our guests. I hope you reconsider not staying here again so we get a chance to show you the changes we will be making.

Summary: The arts hotel is clean and conformable. Staff are friendly and helpful! Partially ocean view and only few minutes walk to the beach and 5 mind driving to the main beach. The little swimming pool is unique and my kids had a lot of fun. We will be back for sure and highly recommended to all Laguna travellers.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words and we would be happy to have you and your family back. We appreciate that you would recommend us to any friends and family when traveling to Laguna Beach.

Summary: The art hotel is just as it’s titled, art. There is a different local artists work in each room as well as murals, sculptures and crafts all over the grounds. The place is older and is undergoing some renovations but is very nice regardless. The pool area is quite pretty with a square pool that has a view of the pacific over the short wall. Many little seating areas around to sit and read a book or enjoy with a friend. Rooms are large and bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was good and some rooms have a small balcony with a view of the ocean. Ample off street parking underneath. Elevator available. Art store in lobby. Highly recommend for casual stay. Close to beach access.
Manager Response: Hi Steve, thanks so much for checking us out and also for leaving us this recommendation. We appreciate you :)  We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We just don't understand some previous poor reviews.  We had a fabulous time in this quirky, quaint unique and interesting hotel  We were met very pleasantly at reception and all advice and amenity was offered. The owner (and new owners) are very pleasant and helpful. The room was fine, well equipped and comfy beds. A tiny balcony for 2. The pool area and art are different and good. There is a supermarket and petrol right next door and easy access to downtown and main beach by free trolley bus right outside or car with ample public paid parking. Plenty of onsite parking and resources for the stunning beach and cliff views right opposite. For the price and type of hotel it is excellent value and we have no hesitation in highly recommending and would surely return.Lobby Breakfast
Manager Response: Hi Keith,   Thanks so much for staying with us and also for leaving us these wonderful words. I shared your comments with some of our staff and they are happy. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: A wonderful place for a Valentines staycation!
Summary: We stayed at the Art Hotel for Valentines day this year and really enjoyed it. The morning of, I received a confirmation call to ask when I would be arriving. This was unexpected but showed a great personal touch to the hotel. Checking in was easy and there was plenty of parking under the hotel in the garage. Each of the rooms are decorated with the art of a specific artist(that's what I gathered) that you can purchase.The rooms did feel a bit dated but I think it added to the charm of the hotel.  There aren't a huge amount of bars or restaurants in walking distance but there plenty an easy Uber away. There is also a liquor store next door so if you need any snacks or beverages, you can just walk on over. I would highly recommend staying here!!
Manager Response: Chris, thank you guys so much for staying with us and for leaving us this recommendation. Valentine's is one of my favorite times of year because a lot of love birds come visit. I hope to see you again next year and am glad you found some good food options.

Summary: A bit far (too far to walk) from Main Beach, but really nice for the traveler who wants a good price, though not necessarily luxury. NOT on the beach, but not too far from all the main attractions. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, and really seemed to care (unlike many hotels we visit).
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us Bill, really appreciate your visit. We don't pretend to be a bit luxury hotel in terms of the accommodations, but we do try to be big time when it comes to guest services. I hope you'll think of us again when your next trip into town comes around :)  Have a wonderful year, Bill!

Summary: I saw the hotel online and thought it looked cute and funky.  Isis (at the front desk) was great, and the next day Gail was super helpful.  The place just seemed a bit "tired" and old (but not in a charming way).  We don't usually stay in hotels (more often rent an apartment or similar), so we may not be the best judges, but this seemed like a lot of money for a room where we could not open the window, the traffic was noisy, and the amenities scarce.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for staying with us, really appreciate you. I would love to know what we could have done to deserve a 5 star rating? When you say "tired" and "old," what did you mean? Knowing that will help us to continue to improve and create positive experiences for our guests.   Thanks again and we hope you have a wonderful and healthy year!

Summary: We stayed here as a family of four (kids 15 and 13) on our road trip down the coast. It had a lovely, calm feel about it. We had a room just opposite the pool which had settee's to sit round which was great. The owner and the lady at reception were both friendly and offered knowledge of the area - the free bus to the centre for one! Yes, it's slightly dated. No, your not booking with a proper breakfast (as we knew). Parking, absolutely great, even for me with a big Buick Enclave that dwarfs my car back here in the UK. Best of all, you can cross the road and your on Crescent Bay. Supermarket bang next door. If I get the chance to visit Laguna Beach again then I know where I'll stay.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the kind words. We'll see you next time!!

Summary: Just stayed here for a long weekend (4 nights) and this place was nothing but a hassle. The owner was very grumpy and inattentive. The first morning I went to check to see if they had coffee in the lobby or if I could get another packet for my room and once I was finally acknowledged by the owner, was told to go next door and get coffee at the convenience store (they did eventually give me another pack for my room). The complimentary breakfast is granola bars and very sad pastries.   The pool was dirty, the beach towels were stained (not to mention paper thin), and our room was musty when we arrived.   Very few outlets in the rooms, and they're not in convenient locations whatsoever. We had to unplug our coffee maker from the extension cord it was plugged into in order to plug
Manager Response: Hi Annie, please see my response to your review on Yelp. I just finished posting it there.

Summary Heading: Decent hotel with service minded staff
Summary: We stayed here for two nights. The reception was going to close around 8PM and the reception desk contacted us prior to this to make sure they would accommodate our check-in. We were scheduled to arrive around 9PM so this helped us a lot. A big thank your for that. Everything went smoothly.  The room was big, lots of space, had a fridge and a microwave and a good AC. All though, the room didn’t have a “fresh” feeling. It had a funky smell, like moist. Not having white bedclothes also adds to that “not so fresh” feeling.  The bathroom was okey, but felt “unreliable”.   At around 7PM on a Saturday night (our last night at the hotel) we discovered we had a clogged sink in our bathroom. The staff came and looked at it and unfortunately told us it couldn’t get fixed because it was
Manager Response: Hi Patrik, thanks so much for staying with us and also for leaving us these wonderful comments. Apologies about the clogged sink, we will work on getting that fixed ASAP. Thank you again and I hope we will see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Top Value for money. Small personal Hotel with lot of charm and a fantastic service. Nothing is impossible!
Summary: Good rooms with reasonable space. Balcony and ocean view. (Room 114) Everything in room works and if any problem, staff is there to help, We stayed for 10 days. Near to good beach and more beaches in walking distance.  We like coffee machine with filter and coffe, fridge, microwave owen and of course the heated pool with charming pool area. Hotel and rooms are not new but clean and done every day.  During morning and early evening much traffic on coastway, a bit noisy with balcony door open, but minor problem for us. Washing machine and dryer to use an extra plus.  Walk to city center/ main beach in about 20-25 minutes. The free water, juice, fruit, small pastries and bars works fine as a light breakfast and 50 meters to nearest small shop if more is needed, Last but not least,
Manager Response: Tommy and Rose, thank you so much for these wonderful thoughts. We were so happy to have you here and even happier that you enjoyed your stay. We will definitely look forward to seeing you again :)

Summary Heading: Not a fan. . . cheap wretched bed and the hard lumpy pillows.
Summary: The name 'Art Hotel' is a play on the fact that Laguna Beach has attracted visual artists for generations. But that's where the reference ends. Art Hotel is an old structure with awkward parking access and located right on the Pacific Coast Highway.  My experience at this hotel was highly unpleaasant, but it was the cheap wretched bed and the hard lumpy pillows that made me write this review.  I chose this hotel for it's "affordable" access to the ocean and location in Laguna Beach, but also expected reasonable comfort, particularly the bed and pillows which were worse than any Motel 6 experience.  My room, even though facing the beach, had no view to speak of, but worse, it was dark and dingy with cheesy decor. I found the place depressing. To boot, the hotel is facing Pacific
Manager Response: I am sorry we could not provide a good experience this time. We make every possible effort to provide the best possible service to all our guests, though admittedly, we sometimes fall short. Thank you for your comments, I hope you'll try us again someday.

Summary: Service is the best! from the time I made the reservation to check out, service was incredible. Called us at 11:00 to tell us the room was ready. She knew we were arriving early for an event and made it possible for both of our reservations to check in early. The hotel is clean, quiet, easy access to everything Laguna offers. Comfortable nice size rooms.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for leaving us this wonderful feedback. Really appreciate you and hope to see you again soon :)

Summary: I love this hotel; I have been staying at this location for many, many years now. Every summer we attend the Pageant of the Masters and this location is ideal. Gail and Isis are always friendly and accommodating.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your continued support over the years. This makes me so happy. The Pageant is such a great event. We hope to see you again next year :)

Summary: Although the owner and desk girl were outstanding, I'm sad to report our hotel room was in desperate need of a renovation. The comforters were worn out, out dated and had cigarette burns, the pillows were very stiff and flat, the room was tidy but needed a deep clean as there were several bugs and visible dirt. Our room was never cleaned, only freshened with towels and literally had the comforter thrown up to the top of the bed. We paid extra for an ocean view room and barely had a glimpse. It was a good distance from down town laguna but across the street from a nice beach. They shut the elevator down from about 7:30 pm to 7:30 am and that was a challenge with a fractured foot. I was very disappointed and wouldn't stay here again. It was overpriced for what you received. I'm
Manager Response: Hi Karen, I am so sorry we were not able to provide a better experience. Especially considering your fractured foot. I know it stings right now, but I hope you'll give us another opportunity so we can show you our best side. Thanks,

Summary Heading: Above and beyond the call of duty
Summary: We stayed at the Art Hotel in April after I had a medical procedure. I changed my arrival dates, and Expedia/Hotels.com said we would have to take an ocean view room ($159) rather than the one we had booked ($139). I checked with their manager and told the booking agency that the oceanview room was not pet friendly, but Isis, the manager, had offered a different pet friendly room for less. The agent told me again all they had was the ocean view and hung up on me. I then spoke to a supervisor who said the same thing. Meanwhile the Art Hotel manager even called and spoke to him, but he told me that I needed to try another hotel. (A pet friendly hotel near the beach?) I cancelled the reservation and booked direct with the Art Hotel. They did allow early check in and went out of
Manager Response: Thank you for your words. We are here to serve, and we're honored to have had you as our guest. Hope to see you again! :)

Summary: My daughter and I loved the Art Hotel. The staff is so nice and accommodating. The hotel is beautiful and clean. The pool area is just beautiful and comfortable. I hope we will be able to go back one day. We felt safe and very welcomed by the staff. Gail is amazing.
Manager Response: Oh gosh, thank you so much for your words. Believe it or not, they mean everything. We hope to see you again :)

Summary Heading: Art Hotel perfect slice of Heaven
Summary: Art hotel is exactly what it's name imlpies - beautiful works of art by local artists abound on the property, near all the beaches and coves in Laguna and it really gives you a feel for the real Laguna Beach area. For me- a slice of Heaven!!!
Manager Response: Thank you so much Owen! These words mean a lot to us. We hope to see you again soon :)

Summary: Gail was amazing! She personally drove us to a wedding a few miles away. Room was very nice and spacious. Pool and patio areas were very inviting. Would definitely return to Art Hotel if I was staying in the area again.
Manager Response: I hope you enjoyed the wedding! It was great to have you and I hope you'll visit us again soon :)

Summary: If you like staying in a non-corporate, family style hotel, you'll love this place.  It feels like home with all the artwork & decorations, home cooked pastries, cleanliness, personal phone call to confirm your room is ready BEFORE normal check in time -  you'll love the Art Hotel.....and no pet fees for dogs!  Highly recommended.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us. We love animals so it only made sense that we are pet-friendly. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We have attended the Pageant of the Masters for over 15 years and have stayed at the Art Hotel  now 14 of them.  While it is not the fanciest of hotels, it is clean, quiet, the staff is extremely friendly and knowledgeable about the area, and best of all, it is at the northern end of the summer shuttle route, which means you can park your car (free) and not drive for the entire time you are visiting Laguna.  We have already booked our rooms for 2018.
Manager Response: There is no way I can thank you enough for your continued support and loyalty all these years. Thank you. We'll look forward to seeing you next year! :)

Summary Heading: quirky but well done hotel at the end of the trolly line
Summary: Hotel developed by artists for artists.  Lotsa art every where.  Nice pool with lotsa comfy sofas & pillows.  Mural by famous artist lines the pool wall.  Rooms are large,  free RFR & TV.  Staff is more than friendly and helpful,  maids are well trained & keep the rooms spotless.  Clean comfy rooms with lots of personal touches.      Walking distance to a great beach one cove away from the main beach.       Great restaurants nearby.  Walkable 1 mile to center of LB.  Find the Pavillion grocery facing away from the traffic...for locals only.  Beach toys & umbrellas for sale.       Free trolley stops across the street.  Nice ride to /from town.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for staying with us Susan, we hope you enjoyed your time in Laguna and we hope to see you again soon. Enjoy the rest of summer! Fall is almost here :)

Summary: It was our 25th anniversary so we decided to head to a night out in Laguna Beach. I wanted a room with an ocean view and a early check in if possible as we had tickets for the "Life With Janis Joplin" performance at the Laguna Playhouse. I got a call about noon from the desk clerk to let us know our room was ready whenever we got there. I thought that was pretty cool. We got checked in in plenty of time to freshen up before the play. We had a nice room overlooking the pool and the ocean from the small balcony. Coffee service in the room and a frig. Comfortable bed. Had a bit of trouble getting the keys to work but the desk clerk saw us struggling in the camera and came up to help. Pastry, fruit and breakfast bars in the lobby for a breakfast snack. Free parking in the
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us, we really hope you enjoyed your stay. And congrats on 25 years of marriage! That's a real achievement for you both. Many blessings,

Summary Heading: Excellent for those hwo want authenticity vs overpriced 5-star "luxury".
Summary: The Art Hotel is a basic, comfortable, friendly place to stay when visiting Laguna Beach. It is a friendly, independent hotel owned and operated by one of most genuine hoteliers I have ever met (Gail).  I grew up in Laguna Beach (but unfortunately no longer live there) and return at least annually to attend the Festival of the Arts and Pageant of the Masters. The Art Hotel is my place of choice when I (my family/friends and I) can get in. I WOULD NOT recommend it to those who want 5 star luxury and removal from experiencing the real Laguna Beach. I WOULD recommend it to those who want authenticity, comfort, and friendliness at a reasonable price.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your words and for your continued support. We are here for you, always.

Summary: We were greeted by the owner at check-in and she was so kind, lovely, and helpful. We booked a dog friendly room and didn't have to pay an exorbitant pet fee. We were also given a list of dog-friendly restaurants that proved very useful.  The building is surrounded in murals and sculpture all maintained lovingly. Original art in each room with the artist's information. So much more interesting than a bland, beige chain hotel. Location is excellent and the parking is free. I repeat PARKING IS FREE. If you've stayed in the beach towns of orange county before, you've surely encountered a ridiculous parking add-on fee per night.  I will absolutely stay here again. The only thing holding me back from a 5-star rating is the rooms are pretty worn and dated, but impeccably clean. Very
Manager Response: Hi Jaime, thank you so much for staying with us and for leaving us this review. Really appreciate you and hope to see you again :)

Summary: We were all horrified when entered room. It was dark, had a terrible smell, felt like we were in dump. Tried to move to another hotel but everything was sold out that we called so we made sure to spend as minimal time in hotel as possible. Curtains did not block out and we could see people walking by our room. Bathroom hot water for shower was never hot. Bathroom lights were flickering and we felt like we were in a horror movie. Tv remote only worked if you held the remote in one specific location.  The owner was very rude.  The only nice thing about staying here was that you were allowed to park there for the day even after you checked out.  Recommend staying at the Inn At Laguna Beach instead which would have been $344 for the night instead of the $221 we spent. Would have
Manager Response: We are sorry your experience did not match expectations. We hope you'll give us another try

Summary: The Art Hotel is exactly what you are looking for if you wish to stay at a quit, peaceful, tranquil hotel.  The Art Hotel is complete with pool, breakfast snacks, lots of beautiful art for sale, and a lovely owner Gayle, that lives on the property.  The trolley stops at the corner and is a perfect pick up to travel throughout Laguna. .
Manager Response: Hi Christie, thank you so much for staying with us and for leaving us this great review. This literally made my day. We hope to see you again soon :)

Summary: Our room on second floor had a real squeaky door to bathroom. Also door to room didn't fit properly so couldn't lock the door with the deadbolt. At entrance to room207 a board was taped to the deck presenting a hazard. The barrel chair needs to be replaced as it is rickety. I would only rent this room as a last resort. Gave us a less than satisfied feeling. Room was clean and front desk was friendly. Pocket park across the street is amazing.
Manager Response: Hi there, thanks for this feedback. Believe it or not we rely on the feedback of our guests in order to continue to improve guest experiences for the hotel. Thanks again, I am sorry it was not up to standard, we will try harder :)

Summary: Friendly, great location, rooms very clean, excellent cost, great parking, close to downtown Laguna beach, take free trolley to tourist attractions of the area, this has been our second stay at this great hotel and we definitely will come back
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and for coming back. I've shared this review with our staff and they are happy. We hope to see you again soon. ENjoy the rest of your summer! :)

Summary: What a lovely property! you are in the right place if you're going to Laguna Beach for an art festival. This hotel is a gallery unto itself, with original art everywhere! There are several nice spots to sit outside your room for some wine and cheese, one on the second floor with a view of the beach. The beds are comfy, the bathroom is large and roomy with a jacuzzi tub, and the place is spotless. There are fresh fruit, granola bars, and small pastries in the lobby in the morning. There's even a pool!  Across the street and down the block is a beautiful area for a great view of the coast. Gail, the owner, was sure to tell us about it so we wouldn't miss that treasure. Not too far down the street is a staircase that leads to this beautiful cove for swimming in calm waters, without
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us. So happy you enjoyed yourself. We hope to see you again soon. Have a great rest of the summer

Summary: Love Laguna Beach and this was a great place to stay. Super helpful front desk, friendlty, funky, artsy. Nice room, right on the town trolley line. Good value for a very expensive area. No direct beach access, but nice views and walks nearby.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your stay and for leaving us this great review. Really appreciate you choosing us and we all hope to see again soon :) Have a great rest of the summer

Summary Heading: Visit the Art Hotel for the Art Festivals!
Summary: `I took my sister-in-law and niece for their first visit to Laguna Beach, the festivals and the Pageant and they enjoyed every minute of it.  The Art Hotel was conveniently located on Coast Hwy, up on the bluffs with a great view of the Ocean.  It fulfills it's name with lots of nice art work all over the place, including a great mural around the pool area.  Its not fancy but it is clean and has friendly and helpful staff and it fully met our needs and had about the best prices in the area.  The manger (owner?) checked us in and she gave us lots of great tips about the area, the Trolley, and a fantastic place on the edge of the bluff to view all of Luguna Beach.  I will definitely be willing to use the Art Hotel on our next visit especially since my niece wants to see the
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and for leaving us this great recommendation. I'm so glad you got to enjoy the Pageant with your daughter, it's a really good time.   Thanks again for everything and we hope to see you again next year! Enjoy the rest of your summer,

Summary: The hotel is located across the street from Crescent Bay Beach. It is only a short walk away. The hotel has beach chairs and towels you can use.
