The owner, a lovley woman,  is very helpful with giving directions around the area. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was large. We had a pleasant stay.
Manager Response: Thank you so much Kathy. Really appreciate that you stayed with us and I'm glad you got to enjoy your stay. We hope to see you again soon! Enjoy the rest of summer :)

Summary: We had a great experience at this hotel. We were coming in from Disneyland and knew we may be late for check in. They were very accommodating and stayed up later then normal to help check us in. The rooms accommodated the 5 of us comfortably. They were clean and well taken care of. They are a little older in style, but we were here for the beach and the fun of Laguna and didn't need modern design to benefit our stay. The bathroom was clean and all plumbing worked well. The beds were clean and comfortable. Wifi worked great. Very close to the ocean and downtown. We always had a parking place. The price was right. We enjoyed our stay. If you book this hotel you can expect a clean, comfortable and affordable room that is perfect for a family that wants to spend a day at the beach
Manager Response: Hi there, thank you so much for staying with us and for your wonderful words. I have shared your review with the rest of the staff and they are happy. We all hope that you will visit us again soon. Have a great rest of the summer. And thank you!

Summary: I have stayed in Laguna Beach for years as my former husband's family had a time share and business in a neighboring city so we have spent many weekends at the various hotels in the area during holiday and non-peak times of the year.   We decided to formulate a quick family get away to the beach so we looked around and not much was available but the Art Hotel looked okay and had enough space for 4 of us; 2 adults and 2 teenagers. One thing I always have to remind myself of is to double check reviews on TA and other sites because they give the real deal on any hotel.   The rooms looked nice and had a microwave and fridge for the kids, it was close to a great beach and the most northerly point on the trolley route. We purchased tickets to attend the Sawdust Festival as our
Manager Response: Hi Karyn, thanks first of all for staying with us, we appreciate your visit. I'm sorry we did not work out for you. It sounds like you may be better served elsewhere. We don't pretend to be everyone's cup of tea, but we are happy to count on many wonderful people who love us.   In fairness, we do have plans to make some renovations soon, so you are right about that. Thanks again for your stay, and we wish you the best.

Summary: The hotel was a bit run down, the pool was not heated and the beds were uncomfortable. But the staff was very friendly and accommodating. It was very close to the beach, the rooms are huge and definitely worth the price!  We will stay here again.
Manager Response: Hi there, thanks so much for staying with us and also for leaving us this feedback. It's always great to hear back from our guests. I'm not certain what happened with the pool, we usually have it heated at 80 degrees. I'm sorry the bed was not to your liking. We really try our best to accommodate everyone and their needs. I hope you'll give us another chance so you can see our best side. Thanks

Summary: Isis who greeted us was extremely helpful in getting us checked in and providing us local information that was extremely helpful. Parked my car and the rest of the time used the shuttle service that was free and convenient. Beach was well within walking distance and access was extremely simple. Hotel was extremely clean but dated as to its accommodations. Bathroom was large and spotless. Parking plentiful and easily accessible.
Manager Response: Hi there, thank you so much for staying with us and for leaving us this recommendation. I am happy that you enjoyed the beach. This place is magical.   You're right, some of the aspects of the hotel are a little dated but we are planning on doing some remodeling work soon. We hope to see you soon and thanks again for everything :)

Summary Heading: A great stay but some things need to be updated
Summary: Room: it is more a motel room, and it has a ton of beautiful, decorative pillows that are completely unnecessary and mostly in the way in this small room. Electricity: I don't believe it is up to code. I had to wiggle and jiggle the cords to the AC for it to turn back on. I could see the sparks  inside the outlet. Bathroom. Nice size but needs repairs, paint and a plumbing job. There was sand and gunk coming up in the sink when not used. I assume this is normal so close to the beach. The pool area is lovely!  Even though I am pointing out these things, we are still going back some day. They are just recommendations for the hotel to fix a few things;-). Thank you!
Manager Response: Hi Snadbe,   Thanks so much for staying with us and also for giving us this constructive feedback. Believe it or not, we really rely on our guests to help out with feedback so that we can continue to make improvements as necessary.   Rest assured that we do have plans to make several, notable improvements throughout the hotel. I hope that if you visit us next time these will be complete, or at least thoroughly underway.   Thanks again for everything and we'll look forward to seeing you soon! :)

Summary: We loved our stay at Art Hotel. My husband and two teenage daughters stayed for a reprieve from the summer desert heat. The staff were very welcoming, the location perfect for strolls to the beaches and shops, and the hotel facilities fit the bill perfectly. What stands out about this hotel is it's personal touches. Through the years we have stayed with the large chains. At the Art Hotel, our room was decorated with the works of a local artist, not a mass production canvas of shapes. The hotel exterior is covered with thought and emotion evoking murals. The pool area provided a space where my husband and I could sit, chat and relax into the evening hours. I've also never before stayed at a hotel where guests could borrow beach chairs and towels to bring to the beach! The chairs
Manager Response: Catherine, thank you so much for staying with us. I really appreciated your family and I hope we will see you again soon. We're here when the time is right :)

Summary: The hotel is only a block from Crescent Beach, with free beach towels available from reception. Rooms are clean and large with decent aircon; in need of a bit of updating but that didn't bother us. Good water pressure in the shower. And free underground parking.  The lady on reception was very helpful and gave us a lovely warm welcome. She booked us a table in the Cliff Restaurant, gave us maps to the beach, and free water. Impressive customer service.  If we visited Laguna Beach again, I would certainly stay here.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your stay! Your business means everything to us. I hope you'll visit us again soon :)

Summary: This hotel is a great value and great location: near scenic bluff walks, the most beautiful point in the area only a block away, nice swimming beach a short walk, convenience store next door, Urth cafe nearby, and away from the crowds downtown. The hotel is full of fun surprises-inspiring quotes in elevator, all kinds of things provided for the beach, lots of little seating areas and artwork everywhere-some of which is pretty bad, but a great service to local artists. Has the expected motorcycle traffic on NCH, but it quiets down at night. Beds very firm but a/c worked well. Great local hotel!
Manager Response: Hi Caroline, thank you so much for staying with us, so glad you enjoyed your stay and that you liked what we've done with the place. We definitely try to create an atmosphere of relaxation and positivity. I hope you'll visit us again Caroline :)

Summary: My partner and I just spent 3 nights in this hotel. I do not feel this hotel was as advertised. Our room was in major need of updating.   The decor was outdated but that I could live with. I thought the bed was uncomfortable and not hotel standard bedding. The sheets were dingy and felt cheap. The comforter was old style puffy and had several tears.   The cover to the ac unit was duct taped on.   The bathroom tub was cracked and needs to be caulked as there was mold in the caulking. Some of the towels were frayed.   The chair in the room was wobbly and the carpet was dingy.   I will not stay here again.
Manager Response: Hi Michelle, thanks for your feedback. Please see my response to your review on Yelp.

Summary: Most of the hotels in Laguna Beach are older facilities.  But, the Art Hotel is well kept and clean, with lots of character.  It is a short walk to Crescent Bay and the trolley stop.  There is no restaurant/bar or room service, but who needs it?  There is coffee in the room, a light continental breakfast (pastries/juice) in the lobby, and you can also get pretty good coffee at the food mart next door.  Free, below-grade parking as well.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and also for leaving us this wonderful review. We really appreciate it. We hope to see you again soon, take care

Summary Heading: Great place to stay. nice and clean within a block from the beach.
Summary: We came down for the May 13th weekend for a wedding. The place perfect for a relaxing walk and nice place to stay. Love our stay and will come back again. It was very reasonable and the pool was a nice place to relax and unwind.
Manager Response: Thank you Liz for the kind words, I hope you had a good time at the wedding. Hope to see you again soon, thanks again :)

Summary: Very friendly at check in.Hotel is not fancy could use some updates but not bad. Not walking distance from restaurants unless you want to walk a mile in a half. Quiet if your inside but outside a lot of road noise ...across the road from the beach. Advertise the rooms as  650 sq ft but 350 sq ft at best..overall good experience
Manager Response: Hi Rob, thanks for leaving us this feedback. Appreciate the honesty. As you know, we try to provide the best possible experience for all of our guests. I hope you'll give us another try.

Summary: What a fun hotel! After two visits, I'm inclined to say that this is the best place to stay when visiting Laguna Beach. It's far enough away from the busy downtown area to be nice and quiet and still within easy driving distance. The front desk crew is friendly and very proficient; a good combination. This has become my favorite place to stay while visiting the French Rivera of America... Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your recommendation and your kind comments. We really appreciate your stay. The French Riviera of America, I like that! We hope to see you soon, and thanks again :)

Summary: AMAZING Hotel!! SUPER clean & friendly!!! Definitely will stay there again!!! Close to trolley, restaurants & shopping! Spacious room, large bathroom, nice pool with ocean views!! Morning muffins, fruit & juice provided!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the kind words. We'll see you next time..

Summary: Staff is friendly and accommodating, hotel is in a quiet area of Laguna Beach.  Large tub to take a relaxing bath. Access to a small market and gas station across the street.  There is also access to a free trolley to take you downtown about half a block away from the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you so much... We'll see you next time..

Summary: I had the best business experience at the Art hotel! It was so conveniently located with a magnificent ocean view from my very large room.  The lobby was beautifully decorated with great artwork and murals everywhere.  Gail, the proprietor, was attentive and helpful with everything that I needed.  The pool area and patios were perfect for entertaining clients. Also was very family friendly.  I'm bringing my family back here on a vacation.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us Steve, we really enjoyed having you and look forward to seeing you and your family again!

Summary: Having never stayed here before we were pleasantly surprised by the uniqueness of this hotel. We had our 2 dogs with us and after talking to Isis at check-in we were confident we made the right choice. Did I mention that we loved Isis!! After meeting the owner the following day she was just as nice!! We were able to walk across the road to the beach. There was a trolley stop right by there to take you a short distance to downtown. All in all it was a great place to stay and it didn't break the bank. Very friendly staff topped it all off. We are already planning another trip to come back and stay here.
Manager Response: Hey there, thank you so much for leaving us this positive review. So glad that you and your 2 dogs felt comfortable! IT was really nice meeting you and we all look forward to having you again :)

Summary: The Art Hotel has a friendly staff, ample parking, and is in a great location.  We did have a few gnats in our room which was a little of an annoyance but I would stay here again.  it is a great value hotel.
Manager Response: Hi Nathan,  Thanks so much for leaving us this review, we really enjoyed having you. Sorry for the gnats, don't know how they made their way into your room without paying! Jokes aside, thank you so much for your business and we hope to see you again Nathan.

Summary: I have no idea how this place is getting the reviews it is. It worked for us because we booked a room and was disgusted when we saw the room. It stunk, the bed cover was soooo old and there was black mold on the ceiling. The lady at the front desk let us out but holy cow!!!!
Manager Response: Hi Wendy, I am sorry we did not live up to your standards. Our goal is to provide the best possible accommodations and service to all our guests, and we understand that we are not a good match for everyone. My apologies, and I hope you'll give us another try someday.

Summary: Very accommodating, friendly. Rooms nicely done and clean. Walking distance to several areas of interest, and great suggestions for restaurants. Would stay again, even longer. Lobby area has nice things for sale at reasonable prices. Excellent breakfast pastry!!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your stay Cyndi, we really loved having you. Definitely hope you will stay even longer with us next time :) The summer months are coming soon and Laguna really comes to life with the sun!

Summary: Anyone that has spent time in Laguna Beach knows that it is an expensive place, especially when it comes to hotels. The Art Hotel was a nice balance though. It is a block from the beach, a mile from downtown and even has amenities, such as a pool, but is a fraction of the cost of other area hotels. Aspects of the rooms are certainly dated and the PCH can be a bit loud, but if your main goal is to enjoy Laguna Beach on a budget, then this is the perfect place to stay.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your stay Rick, really appreciate that. As well, I'm very happy to read your comments because I definitely aim to provide a good experience for all my guests. I hope you'll visit us again soon, when the summer months roll in.   Thanks again Rick!

Summary: We had a wonderful time here! Such a cute hotel, and clean! Owner was very friendly! I would definitely stay again! Room was very spacious, and clean! Kids loved the pool, and nice short walk to the beach!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the kind words..

Summary: The hotel staff was great. They gave excellent info on the Laguna and New Port Beach. Room was clean great space for the family. They have a beautiful view of the ocean right across the street. Walking distance to shops and restaurants.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words.

Summary: Our family of five had a great time at this cozy hotel in Laguna Beach.  We walked to the beach every day, rode the trolley into town for dinner and treats and enjoyed the beautiful scenery of this magical place.  The hotel and property were clean.  The owner Gayle was wonderful and helped us as needed.  We would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us! I'm so happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and that you loved Laguna. I certainly hope to see you all again soon :)  Thank you!

Summary: Art-centic rooms, each room features art from different local artists.  Clean, comfortable rooms, some with partial ocean view. Open patio and pool area, great for hanging with friends.  Free underground parking.
Manager Response: Hi FunkyGPDude, cool name.   Thank you so much for stopping by and also for leaving us this review. Really appreciate you, and hope to see you again soon. Just curious, what could we have done to earn a 5 star review?   Hugs,

Summary: Great place to stay at Laguna Beach. Some might say a bit outdated but worked out perfect or my family. Extremely friendly stuff, convenient parking in the garage, a small heated pool and good Wifi. Good value for the money including a small snack in the morning!
Manager Response: Thanks Petri,   Really appreciate that you visited us and that you left us this wonderful review. We really try to go the extra mile for all of our guests, so it's nice when those efforts land on great people like you. We'll look forward to seeing you on your next family vacation :) Thanks again Petri,

Summary: stayed for 4 days and tho outdated it is clean. remember it's across or east of PCH and yes close to the ocean and with that comes water related issues. Laguna Beach and the area looks like it did back in the 80's and the buildings  have been renovated however the structures are still the same, soft floors,  uneven doors and windows but don't let that stop you from coming here. PCH is fast making it hard to find a restaurant or shop and parking, well, bring a lot of change. Gail and the other staff were kind, attending and helpful at the Art Hotel.
Manager Response: Thanks for your stay and for leaving us this great review. Was this your first time with us?  What can we do to earn a 5 star review next time? We're always looking to improve and generate wonderful customer experiences. Please visit us again soon :)

Summary: I stayed here with a friend.  Very accommodating, helpful,  and friendly staff.  Was very clean also.  Had a very enjoyable time.    We plan on coming back again.  We had lunch on our balcony with a view of the ocean.  Did a little shopping, went to the beach and out to dinner.  Came back to our room to just catch up since we hadn't been together for awhile.  The hotel was very quiet.  Lauguna Beach is our favorite place to come!
Manager Response: Hi Julie,   I'm really glad to hear that you had a chance to catch up with your friend and enjoy Laguna Beach. Lunch on a balcony with a view to the ocean, shopping, and catching up with a friend is hard to beat :)  Please visit us again soon. We'll look forward to it. Thank you so much for your stay,

Summary: This is one of the cleanest hotels I've stayed at. Overall a comfortable night with a very good bed and shower. We arrived at 7.30pm after the hotel had closed, after a couple of phone calls the owner called us and gave us directions to our room.  Some of the lights wouldn't work but I chose not to bother the owner again so we lived with just one. Wish we arrived earlier as we had no food and didn't know where any restaurants were. Thank heavens for the gas station next door. Rooms are more updated inside than the hotel looks on the outside.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words. We will check those lights....

Summary: My daughter and I stayed at the Art Hotel one just to be close to the airport.  I had several email exchanges with the owner, as she was concerned about making sure she was in the lobby when we arrived.  Upon arrival she was very welcoming and a gracious host.  The art work and philosophical quotes throughout the place was quite interesting.  The place is a welcome change to the corporate cookie cutter approach to many hotels these days.  It has a nice bohemian style typical of Laguna Beach, I would definitely recommend this place!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: In line with the style of Laguna
Summary: We spent the weekend of thanksgiving in the lovely Art Hotel, experience start after booking at booking.com. They call me two time to accomodate in the bast place fit my need, they recall me the day of check in to guarantee the presence during check in. Lovely. Everything was perfect, I don't rate excellent because the place is quite outdated. Anyway strongly suggested. By the way the beach is much better in North Laguna!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Perfect little getaway. I had a conference in Orange County and we decided to stay at the beach and commute. This was a great find and location. Very attentive staff. Clean facility. You will have to walk a ways to most restaurants but we always enjoyed the stroll. And the hotel gives suggestions for walking closer to the water. Beach access close.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I have stayed at the Art Hotel countless times over the last decade.  (It operated under a different name previously, so I've actually been staying there for over 20 years).  The location is perfect for us, north of downtown, and close to our friends who live in the area.  The rooms aren't fancy, but they are clean, comfortable, and a great value.  The property has a very homey feel, with easy self-parking under ground.  We ❤️ the Art Hotel!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Dirty and disgusting rooms.  Horrible people running this "hotel".  Do not stay here unless you are okay residing in a smelly room with the probability of being bug infested.  The manager lies on the phone and the owner has no idea what she is doing. She was unwelcoming and unprofessional in every way.  We ended up leaving and booking a much nicer hotel with an ocean view for a bit more money, but well worth the cost.
Manager Response: Never had a review this bold.  We did have a guest who never checked in appear with a pet recently. We were unable to accommodate and make acceptable her wishes. I only have 7 pet friendly rooms out of 28.  Only on 1st floor, to make going for a walk simple. Pets cannot be all over the hotel. This guest wanted an ocean view for her pet which was not possible.  If you are traveling with a pet, please call the hotel direct ahead of time to make sure your exspectations will be met.  Sorry it did not work out....

Summary Heading: Comfortable stay for family with little one
Summary: This was a great place to stay for a quick weekend trip in Laguna Beach. We travel with our 2 1/2 year old.  The beds were comfortable and I really liked the eco friendly toiletries.  The microwave and fridge are a must-have for us. We especially liked that you feel the personality of the proprietors. And the housekeeping staff were very friendly as well.  Like the other reviewers, we loved the granola bars, pastries and fresh fruit.  We would stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were in town for a wedding and the bride to be had recommended this hotel to us. We were 15 minutes from the hotel when we received a call from Isis (front desk) providing a courtesy call that our room was ready and was checking in to see when we'd be arriving. Being Southerners, we found that to be very classy and hospitable.   Upon arrival we felt immediately at home. The hotel is eclectic but once you meet the owner, Gail, you "get it."  Gail owns the hotel. She's originally from Detroit and has a passion for the area. If you ride the elevator, you will experience Gail's heart and understand everything about the hotel's decor.   In our room, we had a book a local photographer had put together of the homeless people of the area. It shared their stories. It was just another
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very quaint hotel at the top of Laguna. Has upper deck pool so you can view the ocean. Small refrigerator so you can keep food cold. The trek to the beach is nice going down hill, but QUITE a hike up, so everybody needs to carry something! Especially nice in summer when the trolley is running and you can hop on and get a lift downtown. Also has air conditioner, a plus in the hot summer!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Gail was pleasant!  Not sure but I believe she was the owner!  On the plus side, comfortable bed and clean towels everyday!  Beautiful artwork by local artisans decorate the premises everywhere!  The negatives, room  needed updating. We spent the first two nights in a room with an ocean view right on Coast Hwy.  Surprisingly the traffic noise wasn't bad.  Left for a night and came back next day and couldn't get ocean view but it was okay since we didn't spend a lot of time in the room.  Location is great, right across the street from the beach and there is a trolley that picks you up across the street and has several stops thru town at restaurants and galleries.  The staff was personable and great!

There are 28 rooms at the Hotel, but not enough parking spaces.
Manager Response: Hi Holly,  Thank you for your feedback. I really appreciate hearing back from you.  We thank you for choosing the Art Hotel and hope you had a great time attending the wedding. We have signs in front of the hotel, window and lobby instructing any guest to call in after hours for granted access. We apologize for not communicating that well enough because we would never want anyone having to climb up a flight of stairs. In the future, please give us a call and we will immediately give access for the comfort of your mother.Thank you again and we hope to see you soon.

I stayed here w/ family over Labor Day weekend for Pageant of the Masters, and again in October for a bachelorette party (2 rooms), and we were happy w/ Art Hotel both times.  PROS: * Reasonably priced, especially compared to other Laguna hotels (it was $150/night over Labor Day, and I think $140/night the 2nd time for partial ocean view, balcony). *Air conditioned rooms (a HUGE bonus on the unusually hot Labor Day weekend) * Pool and hot tub (both small, not fancy, but kids liked them) * Location (across street from beautiful Crescent Beach) * Dog friendly (certain
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you so much for this amazing endorsement. I really appreciate hearing back from you.  I'm super excited you enjoyed your stay on both visits. Your compliments mean the world to us and that is why we do what we do. Please don't hesitate to ever reach out if you need anything.  Thank you again for everything and can't wait to have you back.

Summary: Remember that you get what you pay for, and this place is just ok.    It is not really a hotel, just an ordinary motel that is on the older side.  Don't expect any luxury here!  There is quite a bit of road noise, a noisy air conditioning unit, hard beds, and a hole in one of our towels.  The TV was small, and there were no room darkening curtains, however there was a small refrigerator.    Unfortunately, there was not enough parking, it appears some rooms had more than one car, or others were using the garage.  The owner/manager, Gail was very friendly.  But again, we did not pay for a luxury hotel so we could not expect to have those amenities!
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for your constructive feedback.  I am deeply saddened we could deliver on this occasion. We try hard to ensure all our rooms are clean and up to par so our guests are happy. I apologize we did not live up to your expectations. We will take your feedback and try to improve the minor implications.    Thank you

Summary Heading: The pool area is quite colorful!
Summary: We have stayed here twice and each time Gail has been such a wonder host. The rooms were clean and neat, and the staff was on top of it if we needed more towels. Love the juices, coffee, pastries and granola bars set up in the office each morning!
Manager Response: Hi Jamie,  Thank you so much for this wonderful review, I appreciate hearing back from you.  Did you and the family have a good time at Laguna Beach? We shared the news with our staff  and they all thanked you for the compliment. Please don't ever hesitate to reach out if you need anything.  Jamie, thank you again for everything and hope to see you soon.

Summary: Pros:  location is right across the beach and about 1.25 mile to the galleries and shopping. Clean. Colorful art and comfortable furniture make this Mom and Pop hotel charming. Cons: short staffed? Front Office isn't 24 hours.  4/6 times I have contacted them prior& during my stay there is an answering machine. They do not call you back. The employee that later said that he doesn't answer the phone if he is checking an guest in; understandable, but he could've called my room back since it was 5pm. When I walked in to speak with him personally, he was training someone and explained it to me and identified me by my room number before I inquired about restaurants. This also happened the morning we checked in. Owner seemed stressed and overworked saying she couldn't return my
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you so much for this review, I really appreciate hearing back from you.  How was Laguna Beach? I hope you had a great time here! We have been short staffed and appreciate your patience. I hope to see you and the family again soon.

Summary: The owner clearly had fun giving this basic motel personality and charm.  There are colorful murals on many walls, as well as paintings in the rooms and lobby, all done by local artists.    Pros: Nice clean rooms with comfortable beds and thick towels. Friendly, helpful staff.  A 10-minute walk from a beautiful beach.   Cons: 1-2 miles from main shopping/restaurant area Continental breakfast is pretty minimal: granola bars, fruit, and fresh pastries. An electric kettle would have been nice so you could make tea without having to microwave water in a paper cup.  No spa, as advertised on the website.
Manager Response: Hello Pattik,  Thank you so much for this recommendation, I appreciate hearing back from you.  I'm very pleased you enjoyed your stay. How was Laguna Beach? I hope you had a great time here! If you ever need anything please don't hesitate to ask.  Hope to see you again soon, cheers.

Summary: This hotel is an older beach hotel that has been updated.  The pool area is very cute, with nice areas to sit and relax if needed.  The room was a good size, clean and came with a fridge and microwave.  The location is great if you want somewhere reasonably priced within walking distance to the beach.  My biggest complaint is the bed.  It was like laying down on the hard floor...not soft by any means, so we woke up very sore the next morning.  It would be a lot nicer if they could update the bedding.  There is free breakfast, but it only consists of fruit and pastries....don't expect any hot breakfast.
Manager Response: Hello   Thank you so much for your feedback, I really appreciate hearing back from you.  So glad you were able to enjoy your stay, it really means a lot to us. In regards to the beds, most are at a median level. I do agree that maybe we should have a few more on the soft side.  Mnbcgonz, Thank you again for everything and can't wait to have back!

Summary: This is an old motel that has been updated with some paint.  They did do a nice job making the most of the pool area with some nice chairs and cute paint, but unfortunately the road noise is very significant and the A/C unit in our room was very old and extremely loud.  We didn't sleep well here.  Although this can probably be said for most of Laguna these days, far overpriced for what we got. I don't expect something above their star rating, but do expect at this price to have an A/C unit and fixtures in the room updated so it's not so incredibly loud.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A qualified much-better-than-average (but not quite Very Good).
Summary: Let's first be clear about Laguna Beach: It's about the beach. As for food and lodging, it's a seller's market. So we really want to take a break, see the water, relax. Get a little sun. Relax more. Art Hotel is just far enough out of the thick of things to be moderately priced, and close enough that we pretty much walked to and from all weekend. Even at night. Room was clean and comfortable. The place shows some where-and-tear. Tiny swimming pool (but who needed it?). Two short blocks on foot to one of the most remarkably beautiful beaches in the state. The very best asset at the Art Hotel is Crescent Cove beach. Beach towels and chairs not perfect (nothing is) were loaned happily, no additional cost. On-site parking. Room with water view (ours) is ON HWY 1, so the road noise
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you so much for the review. I really appreciate hearing back from you.   So glad you were able to take a break and relax. Im glad you enjoyed your visit and excited to have you back. Thank you again for everything.

Summary: although it was off season stay at Laguna Beach ,booked 2 rooms at this hotel.my guests from Canada coyldnt be happier w the price and the short walk to the beach.rooms w 2 queen bed was spacious and for the price it was such an excellent deal that we were able to sample great Laguna beach restaurants😜
Manager Response: Hello Rose,  Thank you so much for this great recommendation. I really appreciate hearing back from you.  Im glad you and your guests were able to enjoy laguna beach, all while staying at the Art Hotel. The restaurants are amazing and very pleased you had a great time. Please let us know if we can assist you in future reservations.  Rose thank you again and look forward seeing you soon.

Summary: The Art Hotel was such a wonderful place to stay! We were greeted by the kindest couple every time we came back to the hotel. They made us feel like they knew us on a personal level. Our room was big and super clean. The art hanging on the wall added some fun personality to our room. The pool was great and they had the cutest lounging area around it. The main beach and stores were just down the street (about a 10 min walk). The only downside to the Art Hotel was that the "breakfast" they offered was a mini fridge of waters/SunnyD with a plate of granola bars next to it. Overall, we had a great experience with this hotel and will definitely be staying here again!
Manager Response: Kaitsjo,  Thank you so much for this great recommendation! I appreciate hearing back from you.  It was an honor to have you and your family stay with us. You are the reason of why we do what we do. Glad you were able to enjoy the pool and the lounging area.  Thank you again for everything and look forward seeing you soon.

Summary Heading: Already WOW-ed by our experience - and we haven't even stayed yet!!!
Summary: You may find this odd, but we've already been wowed by the owner and we haven't even stayed yet! We were looking for a place to stay over a busy time this year and I immediately was drawn to this hotel, it's quaint town and the sounds of other travelers reviews. I was disappointed to find the hotel was booked for the time we were going to be there. On a whim, I emailed the owner and asked if there was a wait list we could eb put on. Within a day or so she called me to confirm they in fact had a cancellation and we would be able to stay with them. Most hotels wouldn't take the time to call a potential guest but instead may email them. Gail was so inviting and we are looking forward to our stay this year. Thanks again Gail
Manager Response: Hello Candy,  Thank you so much for this amazing recommendation, I really appreciate hearing back from you.  I'm super excited you were able to make it down last minute. Your compliments mean the world to us and that is why we do what we do. Please don't hesitate to ever reach out if you need anything.  Candy, thank you again and look forward seeing you soon.

Summary: Close to beach, free parking, free WiFi, well kept, clean and best value in Laguna. What more could you want? You could pay 3 times the price at another Laguna Beach hotel and get much less. I recommend Art Hotel for a great family or couple stay at the beach (has a great pool also).
Manager Response: Hi John,   Thank you so much for staying with us and for leaving us this fine recommendation. I really appreciate hearing back from you.   What brought you to Laguna Beach? Were you able to explore a little bit? I hope you had a great time and we all certainly look forward to having you again. Just curious, what was your favorite part about your stay? Was there anything we could improve upon in the future?   Thank you again for everything John!

Summary Heading: Great price, nice owner, free parking, not much else
Summary: To be honest, I picked this place for the price because we were not here much except to sleep.  It is a no frills hotel north of the main area of town.  The trolley stops across the street, but we never needed it.  The pool and outside areas were charming, but the weather was cool and damp the whole time we were there; however, didn't matter for our particular visit.  The internet was absolutely without a doubt terrible, and the gentleman at the front desk didn't seem to be too concerned when I told him my husband REALLY needed it to send something.  Gail was very welcoming and informative and put out snacks in the morning for those who just wanted a nibble.  She pointed us to a great place for breakfast and a great view across the street as well.  The rooms are adequate, the
Manager Response: Hi Kay,   Thank you so much for staying with us and for leaving us this fine recommendation. I really appreciate hearing back from you.   What brought you to Laguna Beach? Were you able to explore a little bit? I hope you had a great time and we all certainly look forward to having you again.   Thank you again for everything Kay!

Summary Heading: Thank you Gail for such a wonderful stay at your hotel!
Summary: We arrived at Laguna Beach slightly disorientated after the swirling, whirling switch backs of highway 74.  Nausea is the price you pay for the beauty of a scenic drive.  Our accommodation was at “THE ART HOTEL.”  Gail, the owner, was lovely with her red hair, as she drifted about in her flowing outfits making sure you were comfortable and feeling at home.  Gail bought the hotel then named it “THE ART HOTEL” and just like the movie “FIELD OF DREAMS” they came, except she had no intention of artists approaching her to display their various works of art.  Hence her foyer, open areas around the pool and all of the rooms are filled with a plethora of various forms of art work.  She sells the products for what she calls “the starving artists” and unlike the galleries does not collect
Manager Response: Thank you so much for coming to stay with us, it really was my pleasure to meet you and have you with us.   If you are ever in the area again, we hope to see you again :) Thank you again for everything.

Summary: I was happy that after finding a reasonable hotel, lots of additional fees weren't added on. Parking was free and the location was good. It was a little more quiet here than in the busier parts of town. The room was clean and the bed was decent. I planned to spend my time elsewhere so it was a good place to sleep and shower.
Manager Response: Hi CamReviewer123,  I just want to thank you so much for visiting us and also for leaving us this feedback, I truly appreciate it.   I'm curious, what could we have done to make your stay a 4 or 5 star experience? Was there something we missed? I look forward to your response.   CamReviewer123, thank you again for everything. I hope you had a wonderful time in Laguna Beach, this place is truly magical. I wish you the best, and I hope that you'll visit us again one day.

Summary: Pros: relatively inexpensive; free parking and wifi  Cons: Very dated room décor – think 1980’s pastel wall paper and low end finishes. Uncomfortable beds – hard mattress with very little padding. Rooms facing PCH are very loud. A/C unit gives you two options very cold or not cold at all. Not within walking distance of downtown Laguna. 1 mile from main beach.   I really can’t give this motel my recommendation. I booked online and reserved a room with a king bed. I knew that I would be checking in late so I called prior to their check in start time to let them know of my late arrival, which they said was no problem. When I arrived at 8:30pm they had only one room left with two queen beds. The clerk was pleasant and told us she was new and that she had not handled our reservation,
Manager Response: Hi Peggy,   Thank you very much for your feedback. I apologize for your overall experience, and I take your feedback earnestly. Thank you for giving us a try, and I am sorry we let you down. I take full responsibility.   Best wishes,

Summary Heading: NOT WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE even though they say they are.
Summary: My wife and 2 dogs were looking forward to a nice trip to Laguna Beach. Booked this hotel. We booked a wheelchair accessible room due to the fact that I am in a wheelchair. The hotel said they did have wheelchair accessible rooms and was also dog friendly. So we thought we are all set. Took about 90 minutes to get to the hotel and checked in. We hadn't gone up to the room because it wasn't ready. So we went and had lunch and then returned and our room was ready. As soon as we entered the room, I could see there was going to be a problem. The space between the bed and the dresser was way too narrow for a wheelchair to get through to the bathroom. So my wife and I knew right there we had a problem. We went back to the registration desk and waited while the owner was having a
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Art Hotel for 3 nights in March, we drove in off the street, Gail the owner was very receptive and obliging, she showed us the rooms and gave us a run down on the local sights and restaurants. The hotel is close enough to walk into the town area and to the beach. The room was spacious and clean, WIFI and parking are free. There is a nice pool area to relax around, and there is quiet a lot of local art on display. Would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again, the hotel is very well priced for Laguna Beach area,
Manager Response: Hi Wazza262,  Thank you so much for your stay, we truly appreciate it. We're also very happy to hear that you had a great time, and that we were able to provide a nice experience for you.   How was Laguna Beach? I hope you had a great time here, it's a special place with its own kind of magic. I hope you were able to sense that. I hope that we will get a chance to meet again, and I wish you and your family all the best.   If you ever need us, we'll be here. Thanks again for everything :)

Summary: Different vibe here, very open and close to beaches and town, Affordable and my room was very clean with all the necessitates in place and working. The whole Art thing is different and cool. It's not the corporate box and should be approached with an open mind.
Manager Response: Hi bmogie1,  Thank you so much for staying with us and leaving us this wonderful feedback. We truly appreciate your business and are happy to hear from you.   My team and I try our hardest to provide you and all our guests with the best possible service and accommodations. I'm glad to hear you have an overall good experience. Sorry about the noise in the other room. As much as possible, we try to keep a calm and quiet atmosphere (that's one of the things that sets us apart. We're definitely not a Vegas hotel haha).  Thank you again for everything! We hope to see you again this year, and we wish you a wonderful 2015 :)

Summary: The past weekend, my girlfriend and I went to Laguna for the weekend and stayed at the Art Hotel. Online the rooms look cute and most of Laguna is wonderful so how could we go wrong. When we got there as we walked into the lobby, we couldn't help but feel like less is more. The lobby had souvenirs and art everywhere, which by itself wouldn't have been bad, but when you add in, pamphlets, hotel rules, and pictures of family and friends, it was just way too much. We also found with that much there, we had to look for the clerk because she was hidden behind everything. On the other hand, the clerk was very personable and recommended several places to try out for dinner. I love when someone local can help us with choices!  When we got to the room, again the less is more feeling came
Manager Response: Hi Steve,  Thank you so much for your stay with us and for leaving us your honest feedback. Believe it or not, we rely pretty heavily on feedback from our guests because it allows us to continue to perfect our service.   I can't help but feel a little embarrassed about overwhelming you with so much decorative stimulus. On the whole, people generally like it, but I can certainly understand your point of view, and I thank you for bringing it to my attention. Your suggestions are very precise, and I am going to give them some serious consideration.   I want all our guests to come away with a 5 star experience, so I am sorry that we fell short on this occasion. I take your feedback constructively, and again, I thank you for reaching out. I hope to see you again soon, and provide a better overall experience for you :)

Summary: We just spent five nights at the hotel while visiting family.  It's  location on the edge of town is perfect, near beaches and restaurants, easy drive to Newport.  The room was spacious and clean with a king sized bed and large bathroom (with a large bathtub).  There were many places to sit outside and read, eat, etc.  The pool area was very good.  The manager was helpful and always available.
Manager Response: Hi Sam,  Thank you very much for your stay with us and for leaving us this positive review. We really do appreciate it. It's always a great feeling to hear feedback from our guests because we truly value you and your experience with us.   I'm very happy to hear that you enjoyed your 5 nights with us, it was a real pleasure for us. Read any good books lately? I'm a bit of a reader myself :) I'm also a fan of the Live Happy blog online, there are some really inspirational stories on there.   Sam, thank you again, and on behalf of the entire Art Hotel team, I  hope to see you again this year!

Summary Heading: Good Hotel Choice Good Value walk To Shops, Restaurants, beach
Summary: Close To anything You Want And scross The Street  Anf Down A Little Bit To The Stunning Beach.  very Central Access On PCH And Right Around Corner From Main Drag Both Ways For The Town.    Free Wifi.   GooD Place To Sit Outdide On ,2Nd Floor With Great Ocean View.  Room Nothing Fancy But We Had 2 Beds, Desk, dresser,Microwave, Mini Fridge, Coffeemaker. Nice artwork In Room, And For Sale In Lobby.    Small assortment Of Morning Snack Items Plus Juice And Water.   We Would Stay Again.  Goof Value And Good Friendly Service From owner.
Manager Response: Hi dachrist,  Thank you so much for your stay and for leaving us this review, we really do appreciate it. I rely pretty heavily on feedback from guests so that we can continue to offer a great experience to everyone.   I am very happy that you had a good time in Laguna, and we certainly hope to see you again this year. Was there anything missing from your experience, that would have made it a 5 star experience? I'd love to hear about it, so that we can offer you an even better experience the next time :)  I can't believe it's already February, I thought the year had just started. In any case, I want to wish you and yours a happy and blessed 2015!

Summary Heading: Great hotel to stay in if visiting Laguna Beach area
Summary: Picked this hotel for our 4-night Laguna stay based on the reasonable price, high reviews and central location.  It turned out to be an excellent choice - we stayed in a room facing the PCH, but the noise wasn't excessive, especially late at night.  Also, we had a nice seaview, which was lovely each morning to look at, plus free parking and fast Wifi included in the rate.  Kudos to all the reception staff, who were very helpful with our questions, including making recommendations for dining and restaurant reservations.  Clean, large room and comfortable accommodations.
Manager Response: Hi ArzuS,  Thank you very much for staying with us and leaving us this wonderful comment. We really do appreciate it, and we're happy that you had a great time in Laguna Beach!  We hope to see you again soon, and we want to wish you and all of your family a happy and healthy new year!

Summary: I live in town I just like to get away sometimes I've stayed here a few times last year and this year as well gail the owner very nice person,the property very clean the rooms very clean comfortable beds I will always come back here again
Manager Response: Hi There!  Thank you so much for your business and for your kind review! We really do appreciate it, and it makes us smile when our guests come away happy :)  There's something magical about Laguna Beach, so we're excited to hear that you're a local. You, more than others, can appreciate the beauty of our little town.   We look forward to seeing you again, you are always welcome here, and we are honored you've made us your home away from home :) We wish you a warm and beautiful holiday season for you and yours.   Best, Gail

Summary Heading: Appalling service and multiple room problems
Summary: We stayed at this hotel before and were looking forward to our second visit. The room keys did not work, and the staff member tried to argue that they did. The shower diverter valve was broken. After the first night, the staff insisted that my nephew vacate his room so someone else could have it but did not allow him to move into his room for the next night. He had to keep his stuff in his car. Fine location, good price, but we won't go back after being treated this way.
Manager Response: Hello,   We apologize for the keys not working. We have had no prior issues with those keys in the past, but it may have been a mistake on our part.   As for the shower diverter valve, thank you for letting us know about that. Had we known from the beginning, we may have been able to do something about it. In any case, we will be sure to take care of that immediately so that it will not pose any issues for future guests.   In terms of your room, there may have been a miscommunication on our part. We were not expecting you to show up with a pet, and the room you were initially assigned did not accommodate pets. We ended up moving you to another room, this is true, but it was actually a better room than the original because we wanted to make up for the inconvenience. Also, the room we moved you to did accommodate pets, so we did that with that in mind.   All in all, we hope you can see that we tried our best to make your stay comfortable, even given the inconveniences that happened. We also hope it's enough to win back your business in the future. Have a happy holiday season, and best wishes.

Summary: Nice installations ! Clean and comfortable. Be prepared to walk about 30 minutes or to take your car to get to restaurants and shop downtown. It seems to me like a good quality/price ratio for expensive Laguna Beach. Will definitively go back.
Manager Response: Hi Sebastien,  Thank you very much for staying with us and for your kind review. We really do appreciate it. We make every effort to ensure that our guests are happy and satisfied with their experience, and we are happy when those efforts land on wonderful people like yourself.   We hope to see you again soon, and we wish you happy holiday season!

Summary Heading: Art Hotel -  My Favorite in Laguna Beach
Summary: I love Laguna Beach and for me there's only one hotel there, Art Hotel. The Hotels in Laguna Beach are very expensive in high season, this hotel is expensive  for me too, but I like this style, and location, near Crescent Bay etc. I was there three times in April 2014 (I was living three months in Carlsbad). Enjoyed long walks around, saw tide pools during low tide, brown pelicans, sea gulls, cormorants, sea lions and others local habitants. Many thanks to Gail and good luck!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at our hotel.  It sounds like you were able to enjoy your stay and relax.  We appreciate you allowing us to be a part of your comfort.  We hope to serve you again, next time you are in Laguna Beach.

Summary: My wife, brother and sister in law and I took a 3 week motorcycle trip from Ohio to California and back.  Once we arrived in California we started in San Francisco and worked our way down the 1 all the way to San Diego.  Our favorite part of the trip was our time spent in Laguna Beach at the Art Hotel.  The room was super clean, the staff was VERY friendly and accommodating, and we loved the pool and everything about our stay.  It was great having access to onsite laundry facilities and we also greatly enjoyed the pool.  Very relaxing and area and can't thank everyone at the Art Hotel enough for the fantastic stay!!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you Kevin, for choosing the Art Hotel.  We appreciated your stay and your friendliness.  We hope you enjoyed your entire trip, and it appears you made it home safely.  We look forward to serving you again, if you're ever in Laguna Beach.

Summary Heading: Art Hotel - A Perennial Favorite in Laguna Beach
Summary: This is an affordable, clean, and comfortable hotel in Laguna Beach, which we have stayed in consecutively for the past 4 years.  We stayed here on our 34th wedding anniversary in August.  Gail is sweet, gracious, and always so helpful.  We love her!  And, we always enjoy our stay here.  It is a short walk to the scenic Crescent Bay Point Park and convenient proximity to the trolley stop.    This hotel is nothing fancy but that's not important since we don't stay in the room the majority of the time that we're there.  We enjoy the Pageant of the Masters, Sawdust Art Festival, and Art Affair and Laguna Beach in general.  At the end of the day, it's nice to return to our comfy room.  We will make it our 5th consecutive year next year.  Many thanks to Gail for making our stay
Manager Response: Thank you very much for always selecting our hotel to stay.  We know there are plenty of hotels in Laguna Beach, and we are always honored to have return guests as yourself.  We look forward to your return visit as you enjoy our beautiful city.

Summary: Our family had the opportunity to support a "woman owned" business.  Although the hotel is located farther away from Laguna's main hub, we loved the ability to utilize the free trolley (operates July & August).  The beach is located 2 blocks from the hotel and down about 26 steps to the sand.  There are plenty of places to view art work, sit, chat or read a book around the pool and outside the rooms.  The pool towels are thick and big enough to wrap around a guy...not like those flimsy ones you get at a chain hotel.    Granola bars, fresh fruit, bottled water and mini pastries were placed in abundance for the morning.  We wished that there was coffee...not like the stuff in the room.  However, Gail does not have the space in the office area.  (There is a convenience store next
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Art Hotel for your stay.  Because we are a owner/operator establishment, sometimes things do get past us.  But all in all, we enjoyed your visit and hope you come back soon.

Summary: I recently traveled 8+ hours to stay here, arriving after driving through bad conditions and feeling ill.  Upon arrival the desk clerk ignored me waiting to check in, instead electing to extend a conversation with other guests about a personal topic unrelated to their stay.  When I interrupted to ask to be checked in the desk clerk became hostile; when I then explained calmly that I did not feel well and needed to get to my room, the clerk became almost irate and ultimately denied me my reservation.  The manager thereafter refused to correct the situation with no information beyond the clerk's continued completely irrational ranting. It was evening by this time and only by the grace of God did I find another room for myself and my child, of course paying considerably more.
Manager Response: We do apologize for the inconvenience that you suffered.  We're generally a very nice hotel with positive attitudes.  We like to give undivided attention to all our guests - therefore we apologize if you feel we ignored you.  Because we are an owner/operator business, we do our best to solve any issues that arise with our guests.  One a positive note, we also believe in the grace of God, sufficient for all our weaknesses and faults, and is more willing to forgive than find fault..  We invite you back, for a comfortable stay with us anytime.  Blessings to you and your child.

Summary: The hotel was cute and charming from the looks of it.  Interior was nothing fancy.  I am a big amenities person and they didn't have much going on in this department.  The pool seemed nice enough but that's about it.  The bed was as hard and uncomfortable.  The hotel was not within walking distance to downtown.  I didn't have overly high expectations going in just from reading the reviews.  I would say that it was a good price, but you get what you pay for.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the hotel ... and yes, our prices are inexpensive compared to the main corporate hotels in town.  We are an owner / operator small business of just 28 rooms.  If we charged $100 + more a night, our amenities would appreciate.  And we don't offer any breakfast because we simply don't have space to serve it.  However, we do offer, at no additional charge, small pastries, orange juice and water to kick start your way to a solid breakfast.   We hope you enjoyed your stay, and we look forward to serving you again.

Summary Heading: Great location, good price, fun decor
Summary: My family of 6 stayed here for a weekend. We were located right across from the pool which had nice couches for lounging. The beach was fantastic, short walk across the street. Rooms were older, but very clean with nice towels and the owners shared their stash of boogie boards and beach chairs located in the parking garage. The place was decorated with all kinds of surf art which was fun and different. Breakfast was pastries and fruit, so that was a little disappointing, but overall a great value, we'd stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at our small quaint owner operated hotel.  We don't advertise any breakfast for our guests simply because there isn't any space to serve it.  So as a good gesture to our guests, we offer, at no cost, small pastries, orange juice and water to give you a kick start to get you to a more solid breakfast.  We hope you enjoyed Laguna Beach and we look forward to your next visit.  We enjoyed your visit.

Summary Heading: Overall a good stay; would come again
Summary: Nothing is cheap in Laguna - this is inexpensive in comparison and a good choice.  The room is good size and clean, well decorated. Rooms come with microwave, refrigerator and a very nice size tub; oversized bath towels.  There is a small pool; the website says they have a hot tub but they recently got rid of this.  The mattress was average. The benefits: if you are coming in summer for the Pageant or the festivals, the free trolley is across the street. An excellent public beach is a 10 minute walk; a great view of the coast is a 6 minute walk.  A convenience store next door.  Free parking underground; could be tight if you have a very large vehicle. There is a very basic continental breakfast of pastry, juice, fruit and granola bars.  For a few days in Laguna it is a good
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at our owner/operator hotel.  Unfortunately, we did have to eliminate the jucuzzi .... it wasn't be used very much and it was getting old and worn.  So we removed it, and the disclosure of it off our website.  Also, on your next visit, there is a small unassuming Chinese restaurant almost across the street - great food.  We hope you enjoyed the hotel, and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Overall, this hotel has a nice location, convenient and free parking, and decent rooms. There is a little mini market right next door - convenient for miscellaneous needs and desires. The internet will only work for you in your room. I asked for help, and the owner actually gave me a little "attitude" after I rolled my eyes at her for her explanation of the problem. Long story short, she made me fell like a bad guy for pointing out a fairly serious problem. Oh well...leave your computer at home - go enjoy all Laguna Beach has to offer.....
Manager Response: We certainly apologize for the interpretation of a poor attitude - it must have been "one of those days", but we certainly didn't intend it to be directed at you.  Every now and then, we do have small internet issues, and we do our best to solve the issue immediately.  But for the most part, our internet provider does give us adequate service.  Thank you for staying with us, and we hope you enjoyed Laguna Beach and we look forward to your next visit - and we'll do our best to make sure the internet works for you.

Summary: We attend the art shows and Pageant of the Masters every year, and we've stayed at this hotel for about 10 years now. Formerly America's Best Inn, the current owners have gathered a funky, eclectic, sometimes strange mix of art both inside the rooms and around the hotel, but it fits the area. Staff is always friendly and attentive, rooms are clean. We stay in 210, I think it is, with a small balcony where we can see a glimpse of the ocean.  What we LOVE is the location! We're not paying an arm and a leg for the prime beach properties (all the more to spend at the art shows), but it is just across the street from the northernmost stop for the free summer festival trams. We park our car in the underground lot when we arrive and would  never have to get it out again until we leave.
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay at our small Owner/Operator hotel.  We enjoyed your stay.  We removed the continental breakfast because we just didn't have any place to serve it.  So as a good gesture to our guests, we provide small pastries, orange juice and water to kick start your day until you have a chance to grab a solid breakfast.  We hope you enjoyed Laguna Beach and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: I'm sorry we only got to stay 1 night. Nice hotel, different from your usual. Clean and comfortable, the bed could have been better but okay.. nicely decorated. Big room, could have had a couple easy chairs, only had a desk chair.  Close to the free shuttle, which we needed to get to the Pageant of the Masters.
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay at our small Owner/Operator hotel.  We hope you enjoyed Laguna Beach and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: a good and cheap choice in a expensive city
Summary: we had a balcony, direction to the ocean but we could not see it. the ocean was within walking distance and the beach was nice and close. also a supermarked was near by. no breakfast not even coffe served. a garage to park your car
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with - we enjoyed your visit.  Our small establishment doesn't offer any breakfast at all because we have no place to serve it.  So as a good gesture to our guests, we offer small pastries, orange juice and water (in the lobby) to kick start their day until they have a chance for a more solid breakfast.    We hope you enjoyed your stay, and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: This is a nice small hotel with excellent service.  Big, very nice room.  Smsll patio.  Nice little pool with nice seating.  Would have liked some more lounge chairs.  Sitting area was really nice but not for lounging while swimming.  Didn't want to get it all wet.  Would definitely stay sgain.  Nice beach to walk to scross the street and down the hill.  Hard coming back up though.  Very nice walk.  Ftee trolley into town.  Was cool at night.
Manager Response: We hope you enjoyed the Trolley - Laguna Beach takes pride in these.  We welcome you back anytime!

Summary Heading: In my case, the sheets were dirty and hadn't been changed
Summary: Stayed here one night over Memorial Day weekend.  Was mostly pleased with the hotel until the following morning I lifted the comforter off of the bed and found a circle of thick red "goo" in the lower corner of the bed.  I slept on the right side of the bed and never even ventured over to the left side and this was on top of the top sheet.    The "goo" came off with a wet towel, so if these sheets had made it to a washing machine this "goo" would have been cleaned out.  I keep saying "goo" but I'm pretty sure it was blood.  Either that or someone took a red vine, chewed it up and then let it dribble out of their mouth onto the sheet.    Wouldn't under any circumstance stay here again and I cannot in any way recommend a hotel that doesn't change the sheets.
Manager Response: We apologize if you had an uncomfortable experience - but I must say this one is a tough one to accept!  First of all, blood does not come out of a sheet with a wet towel - second, "goo" is not blood.  Third, we're dismayed that you slept on a sheet with "goo" on it, and never reported it to the front desk.    All any business ask is that you come to the manager and let us know what's going on.  We do feel bad that you felt like you could sleep in "blood" and never come to the lobby and explain.  We only had one person on duty that night, so it would have been easy to come to the front desk and ask us to take care of this for you.  You stated you found this in the morning, and yet you volunteered to sleep in it that night?  We're not escaping this - but we would have loved to help out - all you had to do is let us know right after you woke, or before you went to bed for the night.  BTW - we change sheets upon guest departure, and anytime at guest's request!  We would have even offered a refund!  We do hope you enjoyed Laguna Beach!

Summary Heading: Just what I was looking for
Summary: I just got back from a two night stay.  I had to come to town for personal business on my own dime with some buddies.  It is in a good location, yes within walking distance to the main downtown area.  It is maybe a mile or so.  The room is fairly basic but clean.  Parking is great and free, unlike some of the fancy schmancy places that nail you to park.  Pool is small but gets you wet when needed.  You get very basic shampoo and soap but many women bring their own anyways.  It could be somewhat noisy in some rooms but no more so than many of the places on the PCH.  I'd try to get 205, 206, 209-211 if I were to go back.  If you want clean cheapish lodging in Laguna Beach this is a place to consider.
Manager Response: We hope you enjoyed your stay in Laguna Beach, and look forward to your return.

Summary: The room was dark, dingy, and wreaked of cigarette smoke.  Even worse was the deodorizer they used to try and mask the odor.  I went back to the desk and asked for another room.  The manager (owner?) said there wasn't another room available.  Her exact words were, "we're booked and we just can't "build another room for you."  I told her I couldn't stay in a room where the cigarette stench was so prevalent.  She said it's obvious you don't want to stay here.  At least they refunded the cost of the room, but that left me in Laguna Beach on a Saturday without a room.  Fortunately, I checked into the last room available at the Laguna Cliffs Hotel a short distance away and it was very nice.  A little more expensive, but worth it.  I won't go near the Art Hotel again, nor would I ever
Manager Response: First of all - we apologize for the inconvenience anyone experiences here.  We do have a "No Smoking" policy, unfortunately we can't watch what our guests do behind closed doors.  We do our best to resolve all issues the best we can; however there are times when a guest chooses to leave. We would have continued working with this guest, but our small hotel of 28 rooms were completely booked and we were very happy to refund her, or let her stay.  We're very happy you were not left on the streets and found somewhere else to stay.

Summary: My husband and I were traveling through Laguna Beach and decided to stay over.  We found the Art Hotel, I had heard it was a very nice place to stay for the price in a good location.  Our room was quite a surprise!!! The furnishings, bedding, linens and touches were 5 star quality. The outside deck area was being repainted, as part of a freshen-up plan. We were very happy with our room and accommodations. The owner, Gail, was very helpful with tips for places to see and go for the time we were in town. I have already recommended it to my friends!  Carol Lowman
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Art Hotel ... we enjoyed you as a guest.  We welcome you back anytime you're in the neighborhood.

Summary: Hotel is decent, but Expedia is misleading. promised A room by the pool. Instead a room by the road. Heather at the front desk was great, but could not do anything to help for my room, as the hotel was booked. room I received was nice enough, but the noise from the road is loud. Just deliver what you promise. Will always make sure to steer clear of any website owned by this company.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the hotel.  Unfortunately, with PCHwy being the busiest street in the city, traffic can become crowded at times.  We hope you enjoyed Laguna Beach.

Summary Heading: Pleasant and clean hotel, very helpful owners
Summary: We stayed here for two nights in February and really appreciated this hotel.  This is an older hotel that the current owners are still working on upgrading.  The room is large enough and comfortable.  It has a refrigerator and coffee maker, both useful. They offer a small breakfast (fresh fruit and some fresh pastries).  There is a small pool.  Usefully, the hotel is just across the street from a road to access one of Laguna's beach coves.  This beach has washrooms and is not crowded.  It's also not a great surfing beach, so there are not a lot of surfers.  (Of course, that's a drawback if you are one.)  The hotel offers beach chairs and umbrellas (left by previous guests) which make a day at the beach much more pleasant.  Unfortunately, they can't do anything about the
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the hotel.  Yes, some rooms have a different configuration.  We hope you enjoyed visiting Laguna Beach.  We welcome you back anytime.

Summary Heading: Needs work and better staff for booking
Summary: The front desk lady was awesome, very nice and welcoming but whomever does the reservations needs a tune up. We stayed one night and the hotel itself needs work but was clean enough which is the minimum. I called later after checking out and was told no big deal come on in when you want and stay for another night. Came in at 8pm just to be told they didn't have a room for us and for some reason they thought we needed a pet friendly room so instead of the king non pet friendly room I made the second reservation for they thought I wanted a twin pet friendly. I was pretty pissed because they are lucky I live 45 minutes away and could drive home!!! Plus just spend an extra 10-20 bucks and go stay at the Inn at laguna beach. Way nicer, cleaner, competant staff (and friendly to boot)
Manager Response: We always do our best to accommodate our guests.  At the time of asking, we had a room available.  Just before booking the rooms, we did our best to contact the guest to verify if they wanted an additional evening.  We tried for hours, with no luck in trying to reach her, afterward concluding to book the room.  When the room was originally booked, the reservation stated there was a pet - and we were never told there wasn't a pet.  We have 6 rooms that are pet friendly; we would have loved to save the pet friendly room for a pet.  So there was just a communication gap between the reservations that were made, the guest and our check in staff.  We do apologize, and as always - as a single owner/operator, we do our best to make our guests as comfortable as possible.  And we do our best to "fix" anything, if made aware of it.    We do hope you enjoyed Laguna Beach.

Summary Heading: A nice place to stay at the north end of Laguna Beach
Summary: I read several reviews about this property before I decided to book here.  I really enjoy staying at "mom and pop' type of places and this one is right up there.  When we arrived we were greeted and given instructions on where and how to get to the beach, etc.  Most of the hotels in Laguna Beach are off the ocean but there are a few that are ocean side ($$$ from what I saw).  We didn't mind walking the block or so to Vista Point and then down to the beach-which has cliffs and rocks intermixed with the beaches.  We stayed at Crescent Beach and explored the tide pools and watch a WHALE and dolphins along with seals and sealions.    We stayed here Dec 30 in room 213-one of the desk employees favorite rooms-it even has a view of the ocean!  And you can sit on a small balcony.  This
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay, we are a proud "Mom and Pop" hotel.  We're very happy you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: We've stayed at the Art Hotel several times but the last two times we've noticed it's looking a bit neglected. At first glance of the rooms they seem nice. However the beds that haven't been replaced need to - now. The bathrooms pretty much in every unit need to be updated - now. The microwave in our room had not "feet" on ye bottom so it sat wobbling on the mini-fridge. I decided to take a closer look at the inside of it as well because you never know if they get cleaned too well in hotels. Well I've posted a pic of the inside and it was horrible. This thing should be banned, no kidding. The coating on the inside was completely burned/peeled off. Mold in the shower and in the wallpaper and the grout on the tile floor needs to be bleached. I'm so unimpressed and saddened that
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay, and we apologize for your inconvenience.  Being a single operator with this hotel, it's often difficult to catch everything.  We heavily rely on our guests to share their experiences, positive or negative.  And sometimes our cleaning crew doesn't catch things either.  As soon as we read this comment, I immediately dropped what I was doing and purchased a new microwave.    As far as the ceiling crack, it's our time of the year to bring in maintenance and review each room.  We are thankful for this "problem", but it's hard for our maintenance people to work in a room because we're constantly booked.  Again, we apologize for the inconvenience, and the situations have been solved.

Summary Heading: comfortableand pleasant stay with lovely owner/good location!
Summary: We stayed at the art hotel for two nights. When we arrived, the owner was very helpful with attractions to visit and made us feel very welcome! The hotel room was clean and cosy and our beds were made daily. The hotel was close to all amenities and only minutes walk to crystal cove and beautiful beach view cliffs and cafe's. There were a few issues with the wifi connection, however the owner repaired problem minutes after informed. Overall, it was a nice and easy stay with a touch of art to brighten your stay! We will visit again in summer for sure!
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay at the hotel.  We're very happy you enjoyed your stay.  We are very active in our community, which we love very much.

Summary Heading: Fun art and wonderful and helpful owner.
Summary: We were visiting family very close by and were there a week.  Plenty of room in double queen and owner very helpful with ideas of places to go and what to do.  Had difficulty getting into tub and she had a grab bar there within hours. No problem with PCH noise.
Manager Response: We're honored you enjoyed your stay. We look forward to a return visit.  As all hotels, we do have our "Mom and Pop" issues, and we do our best to solve situations as they arise.  Thank you.

Summary: Our room was a lower level double queen that was nicely decorated over what appeared to be the original Motel 6 style wallpaper and bathroom counter.  The tub/shower was newer but the square beige plastic ice bucket looked like it survived the renovation.  After dark, the curtain was not heavy enough to block the outdoor lighting which illuminated the entire room and the sound of the traffic kept us up half the night.  The location is north of the village with not much to see within walking distance.  It was nice to have free underground parking.  Overall, the property was adequate with reasonable rates and the staff was friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Hey StevoRC, Let me start by saying thank you for taking the time to leave a review. To our dismay, you were only moderately satisfied with your stay at our hotel. We strive to make it a worth while experience for all of our patrons, if you can let us know how we can possibly make improvements to gain those extra stars it would greatly appreciated. Thanks again.

Summary: We stayed here for two nights and it served as a great location to enjoy the various coves. Seal Rock viewing was a short walk from the hotel. The views were spectacular. We returned to this location to view the sunset. We used beach chairs and umbrella supplied by the hotel. I liked that we could choose the very hotel room. We chose the 2 queen, no pet room 107 which was perfect for our stay.  The room had a fridge and microwave.
Manager Response: We are happy you enjoyed your stay, and Laguna Beach.  We welcome you back at anytime.  Thank you, and have a wonderful day.

Summary: We found the Art Hotel to be clean, friendly and most importantly, quiet.  Noise from the Pacific Coast Highway was not a problem at night.  Our room had two queen beds and a view of the ocean from the balcony.  The drive to the downtown restaurants and shops was simple.  The hotel's underground parking lot was easy to maneuver.  The first day we walked easily from the hotel to Heisler Park, descended to the beach and made our way to Main Beach. The following days we drove to the further beaches. This was our first visit to Laguna Beach and we would definitely return to the Art Hotel on a future visit.
Manager Response: We do receive quite a bit of good reviews about our underground parking.  Thank you for your stay, and we welcome you back at anytime.  Have a wonderful day.

Summary: We were so surprised by this hotel. The location is amazing! The staff were so helpful when our dates of stay were messed up. They gave us ideas of things to do without having to ask. Were were even surprised with a jacuzzi tub in our room! Loved the art all around and the comfortable sitting areas outside. Will definitely be back.
Manager Response: Thank you Melissa.  We're so excited you enjoyed your stay.  Thank you, and we look forward to your return visit.  Have a wonderful and blessed day.

Summary Heading: Not as positive as other reviewers...
Summary: I've come to Laguna many times, staying at various motels, bombs, etc, trying to get the trifecta of location, value, comfort. Was impressed by reviews, but not but first-hand experience. I can handle average but would have to rate this less then that. I had a two-queen room with slice of ocean view during my 3-day May visit.
