The room was drab, decoration outdated and worn---clean though! Continental breakfast really just an apple and packaged bear claw or some sort. Didn't even bother with the coffee. Maintenance was lacking in bathroom and exterior locations. Pool/hot tub small and really not all that inviting. The bed was comfortable and the hospitality friendly and helpful. I thought about booking another place after the first night but chalked it up to experience instead.
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay.  We do our best to keep the rooms neat and clean.  Being a single owner, operator, we do have our issues - but do our best to correct them immediately.  We hope your enjoyed Laguna Beach, and come back soon to visit our lovely city.

Summary Heading: Very clean, big rooms and very helpful, friendly staff.
Summary: Had a great stay at the Art Hotel. Lovely comfortable hotel. Very helpful and friendly staff. Even when we had checked out the staff lent us towels for the beach to use that day to return when we had finished. The Art is in an amazing location and the closest beach access to the hotel leads you to a little cove on the beach which was beautiful and very quiet. Very close to restaurant and shops. Would defiantly stay here again.
Manager Response: We appreciate your stay at the hotel.  We feel is we can out of the way, just a little more, to please our guests, they just may stay again.  :)  We're excited you had a wonderful day, and look forward to a return visit.  Thank you again, Charlotte.

Summary Heading: For the Price and the Location
Summary: I haven't stayed at a motor hotel in about twenty-five years, but I took a risk on this one, because the location can't be beat. It's an old sixties place, kept up as well as possible. There's a slight odor of cigarette smoke left over from decades ago, and the a/c is like a swamp cooler, but the location is perfect--just above Main Beach. The walls are decorated in murals and original art, lending a charm and a realistic quality to this place that is rare and oddly comforting. Had a great night and a comfortable stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Art Hotel - and yes, we are dated, but do our best to keep it clean and comfortable.  We welcome you back anytime.

Summary Heading: THE BEST TREASURE IN LAGUNA BEACH!
Summary: Spent a week at this amazing hotel!!! Prices are very reasonable, the service is amazing! Gail is a woman who makes you feel welcome as soon as you park your car and come to the front desk!!! My lights would not go off in my car- Gail to the rescue!!! I was loaded with groceries to put in my refrigerator - Gail to the rescue!!!! She also tells you what is where in the area with many brochures to give out!!! The pool is wonderful and you cannot beat the  location of this hotel. A 7 minute drive to the beach -  I felt so much at home at this hidden treasure of a hotel!!! Also, my room was very clean, and also cleaned each and every morning! internet in the lobby!! What more could a girl ask for??  I would rate the staff, hotel, location and Gail a 10++++++. Don't miss staying here
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Art Hotel - we do our best to keep it clean and comfortable.  We welcome you back anytime.

Summary: Stayed here at the Art hotel for 3 nights while in town for the Pagent of the Masters. The place is nicely appointed with most all regular hotel amenities and them some. It is close to downtown with all of the Laguna coves and beaches north of Main beach within walking distance. Main Beach is only 1 mile and the city tram picks you up just accross the street from the hotel. Gail was very accommadating with our need to check in after 10:00 pm as we drove 9 hours to get there. I have visited Laguna Beach at least a hundred times over the years and I think this is the best hotel in Laguna Beach at it's price point. It is a small property (28 rooms) compared to some of the other area hostelries and is quaint in its own right. Off season rate are even more affordable. Will definately
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Art Hotel - we do our best to keep it clean and comfortable.  We welcome you back anytime.

Summary Heading: Quirky, economical place to stay in Laguna Beach
Summary: We were looking for a less-expensive option to stay in Laguna Beach for "Pageant of the Masters." I've stayed at both the Holiday Inn and the Best Western Plus previously and both options were quite expensive for their summer weekend rates. I did some searching, and found the Art Hotel. We took a chance and stayed there, and thoroughly enjoyed our experience.  The woman at the front desk was very welcoming. She gave us a lot of information on Laguna Beach and the best route to take to the Pageant. There is a cute gift shop on site and there are lots of brochures and maps available for visitors.  Our room was older and could use a little updating. The bed was very comfortable, however, and we slept well.   The pool looked nice. We didn't get a chance to try it out.  The
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Art Hotel - we do our best to keep it clean and comfortable.  We welcome you back anytime.

Summary: Described as the “best value in Laguna Beach” and I would whole-heartedly agree.  I was expecting something very small and basic considering the price we had paid but was delighted with our room.  The hotel is located about a mile from the centre but there is a free shuttle service stop nearby.  Really enjoyed our stay and the warm welcome we received from Gail and Robert.  It is an old property, more of a motel and far from the most luxurious.  However, it represents excellent value and I would happily stay at the Art Hotel again if we returned to Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Art Hotel - we do our best to keep it clean and comfortable.  We welcome you back anytime.

Summary: Stayed one night and the accommodations were very good.  Room 206 is a king at the rear of the property and very quiet. Although the property is dated, the room was well appointed, roomy and clean.  We loved the underground parking as well as the proximity to the shuttle stop to downtown. Our only issue was no hot water.  I mentioned this to the front desk a couple hours after checking in (there was a repair guy in the lobby who was already responding to another complaint).  The next morning, still no hot water so cold showers were in order.  Upon checkout, I spoke to Gail, the owner, and Gail indicated that they were purchasing a new water heater and since it was the weekend, they couldn't get one until Monday. She offered a full refund, however, since it was a nice stay
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Art Hotel - we do our best to keep it clean and comfortable.  We welcome you back anytime.

Summary: The Art Hotel is not the newest of hotels, and it looks it.  Having said that, it is well maintained, and clean.  Just goes to show that just because something is dated, it does not mean that it does not have to be well presented.    Air-con is a little loud, but it works and that's all that matters in a Californian summer.  The location is a good walk from the centre of town.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Art Hotel - and yes, we are dated, but do our best to keep it clean and comfortable.  We welcome you back anytime.

Summary: After a road trip across South Dakota and Wyoming, our 2013 holiday ended with a flight to LAX and 5 nights at Laguna Beach and we couldn't have been happier with the Art Hotel  With just a five minute walk (albeit down a rather steep hill) to a beautiful beach and a free shuttle every 20 mins to take you the mile to downtown, the location suited us perfectly. The parking garage was very convenient and we never had any problems getting a space.   Our room overlooked the pool and having a small balcony was a real bonus, we could also see the ocean. The bed was extremely comfortable and we had no issues with the cleanliness of the room. All in all very happy with the room and facilities.  The pool area was lovely, with comfortable furniture and was a quiet place to relax
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Art Hotel and we're happy you enjoyed your stay.  We welcome you back anytime.

Summary: This hotel is a great value in the Laguna Beach area.  While it isn't located in the heart of the shopping and restaurant area, it's just a short walk to the heart of downtown Laguna.  Loved the small boutique feel and the easy access to the covered parking lot.  My friend and I were traveling with our dogs and the pet friendly accommodations were just perfect for our pets.  Our room was close to an outdoor shower to wash off the dogs after they romped in the sand which was a nice, convenient amenity.  Right across the street starts the beautiful cliff side walk and we ended up finding great cove beaches directly in front of the Art Hotel.  All in all I was VERY pleased with the value and location that this property offered and would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Art Hotel and we're happy you enjoyed your stay.  We welcome you back anytime.

Summary Heading: Art Hotel - Art at a price
Summary: Stayed three nights at the Art Hotel with my wife while attending the Pageant of the Masters in Laguna Beach.   This hotel is on the far north end of town and near only one restaurant Mandarin King (see my review) but convenient to the north route of the free shuttle that runs every 20 minutes during the Pageant.  While rated 3 stars – this hotel has to be at the low end of 3 stars. Our room 203 was fine – spacious and clean, but could use some TLC.   The microwave was not plugged into the wall outlet because it is bolted to the top of the refrigerator and someone decided to move the combo farther from the outlet than the microwave cord allowed. I moved the massive dresser/TV stand and placed the combo within range of the microwave’s short cord.   There was no open outlet at the
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Art Hotel.  Yes, we're dated, family owned, and we do our best to keep things clean and comfortable.  We hope you enjoyed your stay in Laguna Beach.

Summary: My husband spent one night in the what I would call a boutique hotel. From the first moment we steopped foot in the lobby We knew we made a good decision. Robert the manage was kind and helpful and had a nice sense of humor. The rooms were clean and quaint. My thought as we checked out the next morning was next time we will stay 2 nights. I love Laguna Beach We had never been there before and are excited to go back. Free Trolly's around town can't get any better than this!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Art Hotel.  We hope you enjoyed your stay in Laguna Beach.

Summary Heading: Great value and service in Laguna Beach
Summary: Before your stay, Gail is probably gonna call you to make sure the booking is exactly what you want. She provides personal service to make sure your stay is as pleasant as possible. Rooms are clean and have a small fridge and microwave. Pastries and fruit in the lobby in the morning. Most hotels in the area charge much more.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Art Hotel. We do not offer breakfast, so our small pastries and juice keep you going until breakfast can be had. We hope you enjoyed your stay in Laguna Beach.

Summary Heading: Small Hotel, Big Hospitality, Reasonable Price
Summary: My friend & I stayed 1 night when we were going to the Pageant of the Masters.  I picked this hotel because of price, so I was expecting something basic.  Most hotels were much more expensive.  The location is about 10 blocks north of the Pageant, plus the free trolley picks up & drops off right across the street.  It is also about 1-1/2 blocks to Crescent Bay.  The rooms were OK and clean, but had those "under the window" a/c units, so it was noisy when it kicked on.  It didn't bother me, but my friend is a light sleeper.  The mattresses were almost too firm, so if you want something softer, you may want to inquire if they have any in other rooms.  The pillows were very disappointing.  Flat as pancakes.  I am used to fluffy down pillows.  Next time I will bring my own.  The
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your positive comment.  It's wonderful guests like yourself, that has awarded us the Winner of the 2012, 2013 Trip Advisor Excellence Award.  We appreciate your visit to Laguna Beach and we look forward to your next visit.  Have a wonderful day!!

Summary Heading: Adorable, reasonably priced place to stay
Summary: Right near the free shuttle line and a short walk to the beach, it was not just another hotel chain.  The hotel is very supportive of local artists and all the art you see on the property is for sale.  I like that the hotel wants to be part of the community and it shows a certain mindset that I wish that more businesses had.    Room was comfortable with a mini-fridge and microwave.  Jacuzzi jetted bathtub.  Everything was clean and decorated nicely.  The outdoors jacuzzi and pool are a bit small but with the ocean only 3 minutes away, it's not a big deal.  I would suggest this hotel if you don't want to deal with the hustle and bustle of being smack dab in the middle of town but want to be near enough to enjoy the town if you wish.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind and positive review.  As a small family owned hotel, we always support our community, it's artists, Visitor's Bureau and the Chamber of Commerce.  We take pride in making our guests as comfortable as possible.  Thank you again, and we look forward to your next visit to Laguna Beach.

Summary: Staff was very helpful re: places to eat, catching the free shuttle to the pageant, especially the return. Shuttle drop-off is an easy walk across the street. Hotel was clean and affordable. Yet it really does need a renovation and upgrade. Towels, while exceptionally big and heavy, were a bit thread bare. Decor is reminiscent of the 70s. Furnishings are oversized for the size of the room. The AC was quite loud as it first starts up in each cycle making it impossible to sleep unless set to fan only. The pool was closed for maintenance. It really is a Motel as another guest mentioned with friendly, helpful staff and value for the money. I personally like a bit more comfort so I'll choose something different next time I'm in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review.  As a small family owned hotel, we do our best to keep our rates below the big chains.  With only 28 rooms to comfort our guests with, we do our best to keep the maintenance up.  We do apologize for your inconveniences, and we work continually on keeping things up to par.  We hope you enjoyed Laguna Beach!

Summary Heading: Great value hotel short walk to Laguna's main strip
Summary: Fantastic hotel just one block from the beach and 10 minutes walk to Laguna, good size pool and a small hot tub, Rob on reception greater us and we arrived early but he got our room ready in 20 minutes to allow us to check in. Hotel is clean and quiet (if you are not at the front on the highway) and free under ground parking was very convenient. All in all great value hotel for Laguna I would recommend and will return next time I'm there.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words...

Summary: The Art Hotel is best thought of as a nice motel with a few extras, on the outskirts of Laguna, at a great price.  If you want to visit the beach, and Laguna night life, and don't mind walking, this place will save you cash, and be a pleasent stay.  Off street parking is free, and the staff is friendly. The closest beaches are across the highway and down the hill, just 10 min walk.  The center of Laguna is one mile.  We strolled the beach, then strolled to town for dinner, then took a cab back to the hotel.  Later we enjoyed the very secluded hot tub on the second floor just next to our room.  I will certainly stay here again on our next visit to Laguna. If you walk to town, dont walk along the highway. Choose a street one block above or below for a quieter walk through
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words!

Summary: The hotel is roughly one kilometer from downtown but very close to nice beaches. We spent here two nights from Saturday to Monday. It took some time to understand each other with the hotel staff when we called them to book our room, but once there they were very kind and helpful. There is no breakfast in the hotel but in walking distance there are many restaurants, also indicated in the hotel brochure we found in our room. The room was nice and clean, with a small balcony. We had a good stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words....

Summary Heading: Great hotel for staying in Laguna
Summary: I stayed at the Art Hotel in Laguna over Memorial Weekend. I have to say everything said about the Gail and Robert are true. They care about the people staying in their hotel and try to get to know everyone. Robert was very sweet to my dog upon check-in. Gail was doing some clean up work around the pool and stopped what she was doing to show me how to work the jacuzzi. Rarely do you find management so involved and caring. Having traveled all over the country, I really prefer the privately-owned hotels/motels just for this reason. Overall an enjoyable stay and I would ecommend staying here.  That said - here are pros and cons  Pros -Pet friendly - no extra charge for pets - In-room coffee, fridge and microwave - Close proximity to the beach - walking distance - see below about
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your positive comment.  It's wonderful guests like yourself, that has awarded us the Winner of the 2012, 2013 Trip Advisor Excellence Award.  We take notice of the "cons" and do our best to keep things up to par for our wonderful guests.  We have tried to put in all our website marketing that we do NOT provide breakfast, and the snacks are just that - a bonus for those that do not want to go out and eat breakfast and have just a snack.  :)  We appreciate your visit to Laguna Beach and we look forward to your next visit.  Have a wonderful day!!

Summary Heading: Perfect for us and very clean for dog friendly
Summary: I will have to say they take pride in cleanliness considering they are also pet friendly. I have to say thank you for that. I almost do not want to give this a good review because then everyone will want to stay here! Front desk staff was amazing and friendly. Gail and Robert made our first pre and post baby vacation a wonderful stay. They talked and made faces to my 8 month old daughter and she loved it! Great location near the coves, and great place to be able to walk everywhere. Service staff was also very friendly and accomadating. After I booked, I called the hotel to verify it was pet friendly; the owner Gail answered and wanted to know what else I would need to make my stay better...wow "now-a-days" you just do not get customer service like that anymore!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your positive comment.  It's wonderful guests like yourself, that has awarded us the Winner of the 2012, 2013 Trip Advisor Excellence Award.  We appreciate your visit to Laguna Beach and we look forward to your next visit.  Have a wonderful day!!

Summary Heading: Best value hotel in Laguna beach
Summary: We stayed here last July and for the value I give it a five. Traveled with husband and two daughters (21 and 16).  The hotel is clean and includes free parking and continental breakfast.  We did not use the pool but the hot tub was a nice little surprise hot for my taste but perfect for the hubby.  It is an above ground hot tub pretty secluded on the third floor I believe, it overlooks the ocean (from a distance) and the street, very fun, we snuck a glass of wine, shhh...For location I would drop down to a 4 rating, it is a little on the outside of town, but still convenient.  There is a free trolley during the summer months that picks you up right across the street and will take you to downtown, if you are lucky you will get the oprah singing trolley driver. Be sure to continue
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your positive comment.  It's wonderful guests like yourself, that has awarded us the Winner of the 2012, 2013 Trip Advisor Excellence Award.  We appreciate your visit to Laguna Beach and we look forward to your next visit.  Have a wonderful day!!

Summary Heading: great value even though didnt honor yelp discount :(
Summary: We spent one night here 04/29/13 the location is good, the room clean #213 had a veiw of the ocean over PCH. Fill in night staff great welcoming and gave us a bogo coupon to a nice Italian restaurant. The manager wouldn't honor the yelp $10 coupon for checking in. Said his accountant had cancel that??? It was still there, should have just honored it.
Manager Response: Sorry, I was away for a few days, and appreciate all your comments. Yelp is usually my call... I have protective & fine staff, if unsure - stick with regular pricing; which is always reasonable any day for Laguna Beach. Thank you for your kind words & your business.

Summary: A gigantic thank you to Robert and the rest of the Art Hotel staff!  The day before we were set to arrive, we were forced to cancel our trip due to an injury caused by a bicycle/car accident.  Not only was the staff very sweet about us having to cancel at the last minute, but Robert also called the next day to let us know we would not be charged and to see how we were doing.  Such a kind gesture!  We're already looking forward to rescheduling and to say.ing thanks in-person.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Art Hotel.   We hope you enjoyed your stay in Laguna Beach.

Summary: If you travel to Laguna Beach to enjoy the beach, town and local vibe, this is the best deal in town!!  Free, covered parking, a small pool with awesome pool and outside furniture and a healthy breakfast cannot be had for the price in Orange County!!  My daughter and I walked to a most beautiful beach with awesome tide pools!!  It took us less than 5 minutes to drive into the downtown area..if one had bikes, no car needed.  With a 10 year old, a car was required!!  Staff was very friendly.  HIghly recommend.  The owner was very nice and personable which was an added bonus!!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Art Hotel.   We hope you enjoyed your stay in Laguna Beach.

Summary Heading: very good place to stay in Laguna Beach
Summary: Robert (owner?) at the front desk was very nice and willing to provide all the info I needed (as I'm Italian, food related of course): we also had a short and interesting talk about living in California. The room was huge and comfy and the bed had the biggest amount of pillows I've ever seen. Very safe underground parking lot. The hotel is only 2 minutes walking to Crescent Bay Point, probably the best "secret" spot in Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Art Hotel.  We hope you enjoyed your stay in Laguna Beach.

Summary Heading: Perfect location and so much fun
Summary: We found the Art Hotel on line, and our relatives in the area confirmed it would be great. The location is so handy, with free covered parking right there.  The owner and staff helped us find our way around and keep the place very clean & tidy.  We were able to stay two nights, do our laundry and relax.  For the price it is amazingly comfortable and so cute. Will definitely tell our traveling friends about it.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Art Hotel.  Yes, everyone loves our free underground parking!  We hope you enjoyed your stay in Laguna Beach.

Summary: I explored many hotels before booking at Art Hotel.  It was the best value for the price.  The rooms were large and typical hotel rooms. Location is good and a walk across the street into the neighborhood finds you at a lovely look out over the beach.  Gail, the manager, is most helpful with any of your needs.  Would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words.

Summary: Well I must say its a beautiful place to stay at! We stayed in room number 213, beautiful room great views of the ocean. Clean rooms no noise issue. Our room was next to the jacuzzi so that was a plus point. We used it a couple of times.  The owner Gail was really nice and helpful. She told us about the places to see and eat at. Also the other guy there Robert was really friendly and helpful.  The fact that the hotel is only a mile away from the downtown  is a plus point.  Right opposite to the hotel is a vista point with some gorgeous views of the ocean. You can even hear the seals there up on the rocks in the ocean sun bathing :) We would spend time at the beach then come to the hotel relax and freshen up and go back to see the night life in laguna downtown  The rooms are nice
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words.

Summary: I stayed a one nighter at the Art Hotel.  I checked in late and was taken care of promptly.  The room was clean with plenty of room for two people. The property had some interesting art all over the place.  It kind of had a funky feel to it which I didnt mind. The continental breakfast was pretty weak and just a few plastic wrapped sweet rolls.  I would suggest you make plans to eat breakfast somewhere.  There was underground parking but I got there late so i had to park on the street which was no big. For the money it was hard to beat the place and I would stay here again.  Across the street in an awesome beach and cove area.
Manager Response: Thank you.  Come earlier next time, we offer many suggestions in Laguna Beach.

Summary: This is a great value motel in an area that has pretty expensive accommodation. When we arrived it was easy to find the motel and park in the underground car park. The staff on reception were really friendly especially Robert who was lovely and very welcoming. The nearest beach is beautiful and very unspoilt. The room was big and comfortable with a large bathroom, plenty of storage space and everything that you might need including a microwave, fridge and coffee maker. It was also very clean. There was a small pool and hot tub but we didn't use these during our stay. The self serve breakfast was very adequate with cereal bars, pastries, bottles of water and fresh fruit - great to get you started for the day. The only issue we had was the distance from the centre of Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words.

Summary Heading: Excellent value hotel in north Laguna
Summary: We stayed four nights in a king room with a small balcony, and enjoyed it very much.  The room was clean and comfortable with modest appointments.  The location in north Laguna was perfect for my short commute north to Newport Beach where I had several appointments.  The walk to the nearest beach from the hotel was about five minutes, and the Laguna beaches are beautiful and well maintained by the city.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words!

Summary: My wife and I stayed at Art Hotel for four nights around Valentine's day.  We found a good online sale and crossed our fingers.  For me, a worthwhile hotel needs three essentials: a comfortable bed, a peaceful environment and a clean room.  Unfortunately, Art Hotel stumbled on two of those three.  Plus, we experienced another snafu which was irritating.  The bed in our room was long past its expiration date.  A valley ran down the middle of the bed and pulled my wife and I together each night like a giant taco.  All romantic possibilities aside, I slept at a slant and awoke each morning with a sore back.  Second, when the cheap HVAC unit kicked on, it sounded like a freight train.  The noise of the compressor was so loud we eventually just turned it over to 'fan' so the
Manager Response: I went to guest profile, to better know a guest I didn't interface with, especially for a 4 day stay - which is unusual.                                                                                                    Any expressions of disappointment only makes the Art Hotel Laguna Beach a better place.  About me: (guest) I marked 'middle of the road' in travel style, but am very willing to rough it in the right destinations. I've got a backpack and a tent and I'm willing to use them!  This Ocean View room  is more a feather bed sleeping room versus firm. Won't work with guest willing to sleep in a tent; wants firm surface - for sure.  Never heard about the HVAC, happy to know now to check and repair. Thank you, didn't know.  I will definately review your comments on housekeeping issues. No excuse.  Busy 4 day week-end doesn't matter.

Summary: I made a reservation online...Gail called me asking when I might arrive when I had made the reservation for a date 2 weeks in the future.  Then I called back 2 days later to cancel and received confirmation.  I just got another call from Gail confirming my reservation when I received a confirmation regarding the  cancellation.  She said she was "leaning on [me]" because SHE hadn't properly cancelled the reservation in her own records.  When I told her that was unprofessional and that she had wasted my time (it took me over 30 min to finally get through b/c the line was repeatedly busy), she said it was my own fault that I let someone "steal [my] joy," and that I shouldn't have been stressed about a possible $200 charge for a room I didn't want/need.    I rarely give ratings
Manager Response: I thank this guest for helping me realize how "important" the words we speak are. There was never a conversation about being charged a penny after the guest was sent a cancellation email. (easy to track.)   The call was triggered the day of arrival because I had not cancelled the hardcopy paperwork, when I cancelled the computer reservation. I would rather communicate more often with the guest, when something is is question than not. In this case, it caused to much anxiety for the guest;  This was never the intent. When I get up in the morning, I hope to offer to my guests "Peace & Rest", and the relationship begins with the reservation. I am a strong believer that "No one steals Your Joy" no matter the situation (you have to allow it yourself); but "My words" were misunderstood this time: I apologixe for any mis-understanding.  Everyone has enough going on....I am open to improve my communication skills.  You have made me & and Art Hotel a better place!   Thank you.

Summary: I JUST LOVED THIS PLACE.  Checking in itself was a rewarding gift. As I arrived and was greeted by the gentlemen at the desk I realized he had many books from Joel Olsteen as well as others. As we began to converse about books as he says happy birthday and gives me an inspirational book. Which I haven't yet finished but is extremely good. Off the bat I knew it was going to be a great birthday weekend for me.   Room was clean, and very well decorated. I loved the patio and all the art around the hotel as well as all the statues of bears around. My kids and husband felt very comfortable.  The location was very convenient as well. I had the best morning walk, literally almost right across from the beach, 20 min walk from downtown stores and shopping.   Maintenance was very
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words!  Hope you finish the book; it is a great view of our purpose! Hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Stayed here in Sept 2012 and it was a great place to end a 2 week holiday in California. The room was very clean and a small balcony which is nice. There was a problem with our A/C but once we notified the front desk, the problem was rectified that day.  The busy pacific highway runs right beside the hotel but this was not a big problem for us. It is located a good 15 min walk from the main drag of Laguna but if you cross the PCH, there's a nice stroll along the shore to the town.There is also a really nice secluded beach across the road from the hotel just 2 min walk. As we had a hire car and parking charges can be an issue with some hotels, it was great to stay here where off street underground parking was provided But my major praise must go to the staff of this hotel because
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words! Gail Duncan

Summary Heading: Art Hotel made for a perfect honeymoon location
Summary: My husband and I decided to southern California for our honeymoon.  Prior to arriving, we hadn't booked any hotels yet as we were going for the adventurous side of things and wanted to live by the moment with no plans.  After the first night staying close to the airport for convenience, we drove to Laguna Beach on the search for a good hotel.  We came across the Art Hotel, located literally across the street from the beach. The Hotel was decorated so cute and unique, I really wanted to stay there.  Gail, the hotel owner, was so kind to us and made us feel really welcome.  We stayed a couple nights- spent the days on the beach and wandering beautiful Laguna- then left to continue our adventure in Santa Monica.  Towards the end of our honeymoon I told my husband I really wanted to
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words!

Summary Heading: Great place I'd recommend it to anyone!
Summary: We stayed here with our whole wedding party! It was very clean and the owner was amazing and accommodating! You cannot beat the price at all! By far one of the best places we've stayed small and cute feels like home! Thank you so much!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was the most individual of the hotels we stayed in during our road trip, found through internet hotel booking site.  As others have said, it would benefit from some updating, but it it served our needs well.  We were tired from much driving, so were happy to just 'blob out' by the pool for a couple of days - even though its next to the main road, there wasn't as much noise as we feared.  Pool has several seating options for those wishing to bake and those wishing for shade - which was nice.  The owner kindly accommodated a slightly later checkout for us. Our only negative was the so-called breakfast included in the price.  A piece of fruit, cling-filmed small Danish pastry and a cereal bar, with a small bottle of OJ or water - wasn't really breakfast.  The gentleman who
Manager Response: none

Summary: We found the Art Hotel through an internet search. Telephoned and spoke to owner. We travel with a pet and needed accommodations. Could not believe that the room was only $99 and have NO pet fees.  This wonderfully designed hotel is noted for locate art work on building and in rooms (check it's web site).  While located at the north coast highway, it is an easy walk 1 mile to center of all Laguna Beach activity.  Along the walk are restaurants, shops, and art galleries.  There is a wonderful outlook to the ocean across the street and many by-passes to the beach.  When you reach the center beach access is easy to the boardwalk.  If you want something light for breakfast, you can get fruit and pastries in the lobby.  Some coffee in the room.  We recommend going out if you want
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a very different but quirky hotel. The hotel rooms were large in size albeit old fashioned. However Gail and the staff were so helpful and Gail did tell us some nice places to visit. Laguna beach is a fantastic place and we would definately return not only to the resort but to the Art Hotel. Lovely few days.
Manager Response: none

Summary: A great place to stay just outside of Laguna. A slightly alternative feel and friendly people. Definately recommended for a different type of stay. Crescent beach just across the road with free on site parking at the hotel too. Could not ask for more.
Manager Response: none

Summary: our stay in general was absolutely fabulous thanks to this hotel. Don't get me wrong, do not expect a contemporary hotel as it is not at all! Rooms are big but very out of date and not very clean I am afraid... HOWEVER, the rest was amazing! Location is perfect because you can walk to an amazing beach, in my opinion the best beach I've visited in the west coast! North Laguna is much quieter and peaceful than centre or south, you get this free cute shuttle to the centre so you don't need to use the car at all! I have to thank as well Gail, the hotel manager, she was very helpful and lovely! I would def recommend this hotel to everyone, even though the rooms are not great but location and the beach are just incredible!
Manager Response: none

Summary: A mile north of central Laguna Beach though this didn't matter as there were free trolleys running into town regular. The room we had was a good size and the beds were reasonably comfy with a plethora of pillows. We stayed upstairs and there was a lift that worked until reception closed; otherwise you have to walk a flight of stairs. There was a decent guest laundry, and the swimming pool was fine - from 3 and a half feet deep to four feet may not suit everybody. There was also a hot tub. The swimming pool area had no loungers just sofas and chairs but was nice for eating breakfast outside as our room had no verandah or outside seats.  Our room seemed to have had better days. The TV was, to be frank, rubbish but who really cares, as it was summer. The shower was weak and varied
Manager Response: Pool seats can have longer cushions in order to become "Lounge Chairs". I am concentrating on artists to add significant atmosphere to each room. Most of my guests chat with me more if the are irritated in any way, it is easier to explain the vision, the future direction, how the seating works by the pool; a/c, windows. I believe you were in Room # 208; window is resolved; all a/c units checked & cleaned by an AC expert, not just housekeeping... and finally "new" flatscreen TV's in ALL rooms- since Thanksgiving. Happy New Year! ...and thank you for your business; I take your comments very seriously; by the way did you get "peace & rest" because that is my ultimate goal!

Summary: Across the coast hwy. On the north end of Laguna.  Clean pleasant surroundings, friendly staff, a view of the ocean means you are on The street and its waaaaay off in the distance through trees flags and buildings.  They offer a light continental style breakfast.  Local artists have painted murals and rooms are decorated with their artwork as well.  Cute statuaryandplants abound.  FREE parking garage tucked under this small quaint establishment.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just to clarify, we are the type of travellers who usually stay in the 4 to 5 star resorts.  Going to Laguna we knew this was not possible so we crossed our fingers and booked the Art hotel.  We could not have been happier.  Being on the north side of the town it was much quieter and the trolleys were less busy.  The beach across from the hotel was breathtaking and we even got to swim with a sea lion and a seal that were playing just off the shore.  My kids 11 and 14 enjoyed searching the tide pools and found everything from starfish to crabs.  they could not have been happier.  We had room 201.  The bed had upgraded linens on it and the decor was wonderful.  We spent several afternoons sitting by the pool enjoying the peace and quiet  so hard to find in south laguna.  The hosts
Manager Response: none

Summary: First, the positives: Wonderful location, especially the short walk to the free shuttle stop. Room was a good size and the decor was nice. Bed was pretty comfortable. Gail was very helpful and pointed out the local attractions to everyone. There seemed to be sufficient parking, very conveniently located under the rooms.  However: to me, the main purpose of a hotel room is to sleep in it, and this one didn't work so well. The pillows were flat and dead. The air conditioning, while effective, cycled frequently between dead silence and very loud, which makes it very hard to sleep soundly. There were no blackout drapes, only a thin opaque sheet on the window, which didn't even keep the room dark at 3:00am (streetlights) and did nothing to keep out the early morning daylight. Also,
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the in 2010 and 2011, both stays were very enjoyable, and the location is phenomenal. We had a clean comfortable room, and the parking under the hotel was both convenient and safe. We'll return soon.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Spot in Laguna with a family friendly atmosphere!
Summary: The Art Hotel is a great place to stay.  Gail and the staff were very friendly and treated us like family.  They had wonderful resources in the lobby for area restaurants, activities and maps.  The pool and jacuzzi are lovely as is the outdoor furniture.  The rooms were very clean with nice furnishings.  We definitely would stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very clean, affordable and boutique-like. Nice outside area by the pool and a small jacuzzi on the upper level with a view of the ocean. Very accommodating and friendly staff. Gail was very helpful and informative. Gave us a map of the area and recommended some really great places. The ice machine was down but she had ice that she purchased ready in the back for guests. Not only was the hotel nice, there is no pet fee and no parking fee. Laguna Beach is a very dog-friendly place, they allow dogs on the beach before 9AM (in the summer). Many restaurants allow dogs to sit with you in the outside areas. The only negative were loud neighbors. They were up late outside (talking and laughing) and then up really early doing the same thing. That is not the hotel's fault, just
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very clean hotel, carefully managed by Gail who welcomes each guest with an orientation to the hotel and the area.  She gave us maps, trolley, and beach tips which were very helpful.  The trolley stop is very convenient, right across the street, but only runs in the summer, so in the off season you will have to walk or drive about a mile into the main part of town.  There is a great beach and cove a short walk from the hotel.  Gail has done a wonderful job of upgrading this former "Best Motel" with new furnishings and artwork everywhere.  The rooms are good sized but most of them look into each other or the property.  There is not much of an ocean view as other's have mentioned, but you would have to pay top $ for this in Laguna.  Breakfast could use some improvement though
Manager Response: none

Summary: Really enjoyed our 3-Generation Family vacation. Gail, Robert & patty made us feel like family. With our large group, and lots of little kids we felt very comfortable. A short walk to the Beach, and with it's own pool & hot tub everyone had something to enjoy.  They lent us their Weber Grill to cook hamburgers & hot dogs. We'd stay here again in a heart beat.  David, Lia and Family (Phoenix, AZ)
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Three and a half stars, but a good value
Summary: I will start with the problems, but keep in mind this is a good, clean hotel with a welcoming staff. 1. Ocean view? Well OK, if you have the right room, go out on the balcony and stand up you will see the ocean. Don;t think you are going to sit and watch the sunset from your room, it won't happen. 2. Hard to get around if you are handicapped. The elevator does not work at night and doesn't start until about 7:30 in the morning. 3. Not much of a breakfast, but you will get an apple, banana, a small pastry and a nut bar. Should tide you over until lunch. Good points - clean, well maintained, good size rooms, coffee in the room, next to a Stop and Shop that opens at 5:00 AM and closes late so you can get a coffee and the paper in the morning or some snacks in the evening at a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for a great price!
Summary: The art hotel is a good hotel for a good price! The beach is just right across the  street walking distance. The free trolley ride is just right across the street and runs every 20 minutes into town. The service of the hotel is good.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: OMG, these people ripped me off!!!
Summary: first of all, Gail (I think she may be the manager) booked my reservations for the wrong month.  My tickets for the Pageant of the Masters were for July 16th, so I booked the Art Hotel for the 15, 16, and 17 of JULY 2012.  She reserved my room for June, accidentally.  Once she realized the mistake around June 20th 2012, she called me and explained the error and asked me if I would be interested in another property on the ocean side of PCH and I said ok, I am a flexible person.  During the phone call she promised me it would be at the same price, why would I disagree?  I went along with her solution.  I ended up at the Sea Cliff Inn, 1661 S. Coast Hwy., LB CA.  the room was not bad, but when I booked the reservation initially I did not care about ocean view nor beach access.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great value, good location, and friendly staff!
Summary: This little gem is a perfect spot for anyone looking for a clean room and hospitality. I stayed there with my 2 kids and husband for 2 nights. The owners were extremely helpful and knowledgeable about the area. This place is nothing fancy but it is well maintained, very clean, and perfect if you are looking for a afforable place to stay. I would highly recommend this little family/pet friendly hotel. The breakfast is very minimal but we went next door to the convenience store for good coffee and donuts. We spent our money on art and entertainment, not on an overpriced hotel room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Good value despite smelly rooms - free trolley to downtown, crescent bay beach within walk able distance, free parking, ok rooms, free wi fi.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I can't say enough so where do I start?  I start with Gail.  She is one of the best people you could ever rent a room from, hands down.  She gets 10 stars in my book, and so does every faucet of this hotel and vacation experience!   I want to respond to the bad review at the top of the reviews.  I'm sure this was a terrible bump in your vacation road but if you had to be displaced doe to humane error, this was the lady to get you handled properly.  I know Gail would always go above and beyond for everyone.  The comments you made regarding street noise is not true and they are very close to the downtown area with shopping ect.. Me and my girlfriends have been visiting Laguna for many years and this is by far the most and best bang for your buck and the real bonus are the owners.
Manager Response: Thank You for your kindness!

Summary: Arrived at this hotel.  All I can say it seemed nice, but when we finally got served they had screwed up our booking, wrong dates even though our paperwork showed the correct dates.  They did sort us out a new place to stay but we had to pay the extra cost, maybe I am a distrusting person but I didn't like how this felt, specially since we were looking at a cheap relaxing part to a liong driving trip.  can't coment on the rooms, but if anything like the other place being right on the road would be noisy. also it is a long way away from the local beaches and shops.
Manager Response: A tough moment when was an owner, I, myself,  scheduled the booking on the 12th of June versus the 2nd of June.  This had not happened before. No excuse, an error on my part. When we have phone numbers, we verify bookings the Monday before the next week-end. This booking was 3rd party with no phone number - or we may have caught my error.  I will say this, you will taken care of --- to the best of my ability, if there is an error on my part.  I re-located these 2 couples to a hotel on the ocean side. I am on the in-land side.  They booked a 2 Standard rooms @ the Art Hotel and were offered an option of an Ocean View . I would have contributed any difference in the Standard room situation. The Manager of the re-located hotel called and said "They are situated and happy".  These 2 couples helped us shore up our systems of double & triple checking our future reservations and I "thank them" for that.

Summary: Traveling much it was so nice to stay in a hotel and in a town that showed its appreciation for your decision to stay with and in their community.  The staff were helpful, courteous, respectful and fun to be around, you are a short walk from beautiful tide pools and the downtown area full of outstanding art everywhere.  Literally could go on and on about this place, thank you Art hotel and Laguna beach for a beautiful weekend!
Manager Response: none
